Safety checks
We need some help doing maintenance, so\nif we could get Pokémon that are good with\nhigh places, that would be great.
Flight escort
I would like Dragon-type Pokémon!\nThese sacred creatures of legend are the\nmost fitting to watch over my air travels!
Dependable security guard
I work in airport security.\nWe’d like to get Pokémon that are skilled in\nmartial arts to come help us out.
Fixing up the city’s electrical grid
We need some help setting up power lines.\nIt’d be great if we could get Pokémon that are\nimmune to electricity.
Fixing up the city’s lights
We need to do some work on power lines, so\nif we could get Pokémon that are good at\nmanipulating electricity, that’d be great.
Railcar inspection and maintenance
We would like some help from Pokémon that\nknow a lot about metal. You know, Pokémon that\nare pretty metallic themselves!
Pokémon strong against physical attacks
They might get zapped a bit by electricity, but\nwe would really like to get some powerful\nPokémon that are good with rocky terrain!
Substation servicing
When it comes to inspecting transformer\nstations, nothing does a better job than\nElectric-type Pokémon!
Pokémon resistant to chemicals, please...
We are running some experiments involving\nchemical reactions. We’d like to receive Pokémon\nthat can withstand hazardous chemicals!
Researching mysterious powers
Please let us research the mysterious psychic\npowers that certain Pokémon can use.
Solving unsolved mysteries
In order to help us solve many inexplicable\nmysteries, please send us Pokémon that are\nreally haunting.
Horror TV show production
I want to create a horror show the likes of which\nhave never been seen. Please send me Pokémon\nthat are good at being terrifying!
Muscle talk
I want to inform people about the importance of\nkeeping in shape! Could you send me Pokémon\nwith amazing muscles?
Cooking competition show
I’m looking to create a red-hot cooking\ncompetition show—one that’s on FIRE! Do you\nhave any ideas for Pokémon that’d help?
Construction work, heavy lifting
Construction needs power!\nPower means muscles!\nPlease send Pokémon with big muscles!
Appearances matter for security guards
There’s a dangerous area we need to keep folks\nout of. I need fierce-looking Pokémon. No need\nfor them to do anything. I just need them around.
Construction survey
I’d like to do a proper survey of the land\ncondition before we begin construction.\nAre there Pokémon that could help me out?
Normal help is the best help
I want to create dishes that’ll be accepted by\neveryone. I’d like to get input from common,\nplain, normal Pokémon.
Cold delivery
In order to transport frozen foods in the perfect\nenvironment, we need some chilly Pokémon.
Good water makes good food
Clean water is the basis for delicious meals!\nWe’d like to hire Pokémon that have an eye for\nwater quality.
Looking to promote insurance policies
The sole purpose of this job is to demonstrate\nthe dangers of poison—nothing more.\nShow us your best moves!
A type that can handle danger, please
Transporting money can be dangerous.\nWe’d like to hire Pokémon that have a dark\naura about them, to scare away any bad guys.
To protect our investments
We’d like to see Pokémon that look strong\nenough to deter even the most determined\ncriminals. Please send us Dragon types!
We need help in the air
On and on, over the horizon...\nWe hope that Pokémon that have fallen in love\nwith the sky will come fly with us.
Pokémon that can deliver in any weather
We would like to hire Dragon-type Pokémon\ncapable of flying through even the roughest\nweather conditions.

We need some solid help for shipping
We’d really appreciate getting solid Pokémon\nthat are really well-grounded to help us lug\nsome big luggage.
Time to do some maintenance
There’ve been some problems reported about\nthe tracks we use. We’d like Steel-type Pokémon\nto come have a look for us.
We need Pokémon that can handle cold
We need to get our shipments through blizzards,\nand the best type of Pokémon to do that is\nIce-type Pokémon!
We need some quick cleaning!
Looking for housekeeping services!\nWe need a Pokémon that can quickly clean up\nany mess like a little house fairy!
Provide the best service at all times!
We need Normal-type Pokémon, since they’re\ngood at handling all sorts of different customers.
The delicious secret of our hotel
The secret to cooking is fire!\nWe welcome any Fire-type Pokémon, as they’re\ngreat at working with flames.
Cute, fantastical Pokémon wanted
We need help cleaning up guest rooms.\nWe would like Pokémon that are cute and pure\nto come help us out.
Capable customer reception required
We would like to have Normal-type Pokémon\nfor customer reception, as they are able to\nhandle many different situations and tasks.
Cooking temperature is all important
Our cook needs assistants!\nPlease send Fire-type Pokémon that are good\nat maintaining perfect cooking temperatures!
A show that will chill you to the bone...
We’re doing a show about haunted photos.\nCould we get Pokémon that would make\nconvincing photos of this sort?
A super-exciting show!
We want to make movies that really have a sense\nof impact—of scale. Could we hire Dragon-type\nPokémon to help out?
A good show about cleaning
We’re doing a special on sewer systems!\nCould we get Poison-type Pokémon? They\ncan handle the smell.
To meet our customers’ needs!
System engineers need to be able to tell\nexactly what customers want. Send us Pokémon\nthat can read minds somehow.
Keep an eye on our network!
It’s a simple job of just keeping an eye on our\nvarious networks. Please send us Pokémon that\nare good with different signals and wavelengths.
Check with psychic powers!
Debugging can be mind-bending sometimes...\nAre there Pokémon that could maybe use some\nmysterious powers to find bugs?
Handling complaints
Complaint management means dealing with the\ngrudges and curses of the customers.\nIs there a type of Pokémon that loves these?
Help with cooking!
Need cooking assistants.\nMust be good with fire.
We want sparkly clean floors!
We need help waxing the floors!\nAccepting any Pokémon that can make the floors\nhere chillingly easy to slip on!
I want more contracts!
I feel like I could get more contracts if I was with\nPokémon that look like they’ve actually seen\nthe afterlife!
Not trying to scare anyone...
I’d like to do my rounds with Dark-type Pokémon\nto give my offers a bit more...gravitas.
Cute receptionists, please
We’d like cute, delicate Pokémon to man our\nfront desk. It would do wonders to add some\ncheer to the place!
To provide the best customer care
We are looking for Normal-type Pokémon that\ncan flexibly respond to the needs of all\nour customers.
We want help solving problems!
We are looking for Psychic-type Pokémon\nso that they can sense the thoughts and needs\nof any customer experiencing troubles.
To keep our guests toasty warm
We are looking for Fire-type Pokémon so that\ncustomers who are sensitive to the cold can have\nrooms that are toasty warm.
Mixing together dangerous chemicals
One man’s poison is another man’s tonic.\nWe would like Poison-type Pokémon to help\nus prepare prescriptions.
Pokémon immune to poison, please!
We sometimes need to make use of potentially\npoisonous chemicals. We would like Steel-type\nPokémon since they are immune to poison.
Customer acquisition
We’d like to have Pokémon that are cute and\ncharming come over to help attract customers!
Into the shrubbery!
We often have to make deliveries to really\ngrassy areas, so Grass-type Pokémon would be\na huge help.
Help wanted finding books
We would really be grateful if Psychic-type\nPokémon could come and use its powers to\nquickly search for the books we have in stock!
Help wanted carrying books
We would like to have really strong Pokémon\ncome help us, since we need to carry heavy\nbooks like dictionaries and whatnot.
Spreading spooky knowledge
I want to set up a section on occult books!\nDo you think you could send me Ghost-type\nPokémon to do the advertising?
Recording the cries of bugs
Recordings of the superb cries of Bug-type\nPokémon are all the rage now, and we’d like\nto record yours, too!
We need some music around here
We need help wiring up audio equipment and\nthe like. Pokémon that have a knack for that sort\nof thing are more than welcome.
Keeping our veggies fresh
Vegetables need to be crisp and well hydrated!\nWe’d love to have some Water-type Pokémon\ncome and help us out.
A speedy delivery!
Food needs to be delivered fresh!\nWe need help from Pokémon that are at home\nin the sky!
Our specialty dishes
We’re awful proud of the grill here at our\nrestaurant. We’d be grateful for Pokémon\nthat can keep the flame going while we grill!
Recruiting customer support
All our customers must be treated equally!\nWe need exemplary Normal-type Pokémon\nto help us out!
Surprise delivery
We firmly believe that surprise is the spice of life.\nWe’d like to get Pokémon that can bring people’s\norders with a little dash of horror.
Gotta keep things growing!
The dirt dictates how well plants do.\nWe ask Ground-type Pokémon to come and help\nus create fertilizer.
Our flowers need help
All plants need water!\nAnd as it so happens, Water-type Pokémon are\nthe best at watering plants!
I want my plants to grow
I’ve got some plants that only grow on rocky\nterrain. I’d like some rough, Rock-type Pokémon\nto keep my precious plants company.
Looking for flowers
I want to go to the forest to pick flowers, but it’s\nfull of dangers! Could I have some Poison-type\nPokémon, since they’re good against plants?
To make our food even more delicious
We need Dragon-type Pokémon to help us\nprepare our food before we cook it.\nWe’re not sure why!
You can’t cook without it!
Ice is needed for everything in the food industry,\nwhether it’s for dishes or drinks. We need the\nhelp of Ice-type Pokémon!
To properly season our dishes
Rock salt, as the name implies, can be found\nwithin rocks. We need the help of rock-solid\nPokémon to get it!
We’ve started a food delivery service
Food is best eaten hot! We’d like to see some\nFlying-type Pokémon to help fly our meals\ndirectly to our customers.
Good water for our desserts
In order to create delicious, moist desserts,\nI would like to ask for Water-type Pokémon to\nhelp in measuring out the ingredients.
To make delightfully chilled desserts
In order to make delightfully chilled desserts,\nI would like to have some Ice-type Pokémon\ncome to help out with temperature management.
The basics of cooking
In order to ensure the perfect stove temperature\nwhen cooking, I want to have Pokémon that are\ngood at burning things come help.
Add a bit of color and fragrance
It would be marvelous if we could decorate our\nmerchandise shelves with lots of plants.\nCould we have Grass-type Pokémon come help?
What it means to roast beans
The temperature needs to be just right when\nroasting coffee beans. Would you be so kind as\nto send over Fire-type Pokémon?
We want to use the best water
We want to take particular care in what water we\nuse to brew my coffee. I’d like Pokémon that are\nknowledgeable about such things.
For safe and quick deliveries
Swift and graceful deliveries!\nWe’d like to have Flying-type Pokémon like\nPelipper come help us out!
We need help sorting our packages
We’re recruiting for help sorting out electronics\nthat need to delivered. We’re looking for\nPokémon that are good with metal.
I want our ranch to be a good place
Please send Grass-type Pokémon that can keep\nan eye on the quality of the turf around\nour ranch!
So that our crops stay healthy
We are welcoming Bug-type Pokémon to help\nthin out the weeds growing in our farmland!
Need help plowing fields
Any Pokémon that have strong arms are\nwelcome. We need help plowing our fields!
Help wanted on our farm
Nobody can deny that Grass-type Pokémon\nare the best at handling plants! We would be\noverjoyed if some could help us out!
Time to harvest!
We’re hoping to get some help for harvesting\nour vegetables. Bug-type Pokémon are always\na huge help!
Need help watering wide areas
We are looking to water our plants from the sky.\nFlying-type Pokémon, please feel free to apply!
So you think you’re strong?
A strong body is the greatest tool on any\nconstruction site! We’re looking for\nFighting-type Pokémon!
Making a sound foundation
We need to level the ground where we’re\nplanning to do construction. We really need\nGround-type Pokémon to help us out!
Falling rocks hurt quite a bit
Falling rocks can be a real hazard where we work.\nPokémon that know a lot about rocks,\nplease help!
Nothing too serious
We’ve had some problems with people falling\nasleep on the job. We’d like to have intimidating\nPokémon around to keep an eye on things.
Foundation for assembling railcars
We are building teams that will assemble our\nrailcars. We’re looking for Ground-type\nPokémon to help us out.
Assembling our trains
We need Steel-type Pokémon and their skill\nin using metal and machines to help assemble\nour railcars.
Testing our railcars
We would appreciate Electric-type Pokémon\nthat could help power the machinery used in\nassembly of our railcars.
Assembling ships
Ship assembly requires a lot of steel to be cut.\nWe’re looking for Steel-type Pokémon to come\nhelp us out!
Hull inspectors wanted!
We need Water-type Pokémon to dive beneath\nthe ships and inspect the hulls.
We’re building a massive ship!
When building ships, we use electricity to\nweld large blocks together. We would like\nPokémon that could help out with this.
Building a solid car
Solid, steady Ground-type Pokémon provide\nthe ideal foundation to build cars upon!\nLet’s build cars together!
As guidelines for durability
We need superbly durable Steel-type Pokémon\nto help out with car manufacturing.\nLet’s build cars together!
Show us your motivation
We need Pokémon with burning motivation—\na fire in their hearts!\nWe need the heat of your passion!
Poison against poison, just in case
We would like to enlist the help of Poison-type\nPokémon, as they are no doubt resistant\nto toxins.
Experimenting with medicinal herbs
Medicinal herbs are best handled by Pokémon\nthat are familiar with various leaves and roots.
We need some nets!
The only Pokémon capable of creating nets that\nare both durable and flexible are Bug-type\nPokémon! We want you!
Delicious delightful ice cream
I want to make a deliciously chilled ice cream.\nPlease send Ice-type Pokémon!

I would like Normal-type Pokémon to show off\nhow delicious my sweets are by eating them in a\ndelicious way.

I really want to emphasize how light and fluffy\nour products are. Please send\nFairy-type Pokémon!
Need some help with digging
We need Pokémon that know a lot about the\nground, since we’re trying to mine the ore here in\nthe Galar region. Please send Ground types!
Removing impurities
We need to remove impurities from various\nmetals. We need Pokémon who can handle flame,\nso please send Fire-type Pokémon!
Electricity is so useful!
We use electricity to remove impurities from\ncopper, so we would like to hire\nElectric-type Pokémon!
Get those rocks out of the way!
There are always large rocks kicking around the\nmining area. We’d like to have Rock-type\nPokémon, since they know how to deal with rocks.

We want to develop durable cloth that can stand\nup to even the harshest treatment. We request\nDark-type Pokémon to help out with this!
Even in the vacuum of space
We’re hoping to create fabric that can be used\nin space! Please send Flying-type Pokémon!

Text File : tips

You haven’t learned anything yet!\c

[VAR 0201(0000)]/[VAR 0201(0001)]
Adventure Guide
[~ 5]
Open the X menu by pressing the [VAR FF00(0006)]X Button[VAR FF00(0000)]!\n\nYou can save your progress by selecting [VAR FF00(0006)]Save[VAR FF00(0000)]\nfrom the X menu!\n\nYou can also check your location and your next\ndestination by selecting the [VAR FF00(0006)]Town Map[VAR FF00(0000)].\n\nAnd you can check this Adventure Guide anytime you\nwant in the Key Items section of your Bag.
Open the X menu by pressing the [VAR FF00(0006)]X Button[VAR FF00(0000)]!\n\nYou can save your progress by selecting [VAR FF00(0006)]Save[VAR FF00(0000)]\nfrom the X menu!\n\nAnd you can check this Adventure Guide anytime you\nwant in the Key Items section of your Bag.
Y-Comm
Y-Comm offers many ways to connect with other\nplayers! You’ll be welcome to swap Pokémon, take\npart in Pokémon battles, and more!\n\nThere’s never a shortage of things to do!
This is called a stamp. Your stamps will be sent to\nothers when you open up the Y-Comm menu and\nchoose one of the options there to try to connect\nwith your fellow Trainers! Stamps come with messages,\ntoo, so everyone can understand just what you’re\ninterested in.
Normally, you can use Y-Comm to connect with\npeople close-by. But if you press the + Button and\nconnect to the internet, you’ll be able to connect with\npeople around the world!
When stamps arrive in Y-Comm while you’re out\non your adventure, it means that other Trainers are\naround and looking for someone to connect with.\nPress the Y Button to see who’s around!
Select a stamp that shows the silhouette of a Pokémon\non it, and you’ll be able to team up with your fellow\nTrainers to battle Pokémon!
Pokémon League Cards
Show off your achievements by making a League Card!\nYou can customize your card using the Card Maker\nfound at every Pokémon Center. Doing so will also\nupdate your card with all your latest information!
Trainers all have their own League Cards, and you can\nswap cards with other Trainers that you connect with\nusing communication features. You can view all the\nLeague Cards you’ve collected by checking out your\nalbum, which you can find in the League Card option\nof the X menu.
From the X menu, you can select League Card and\nthen Album to view the League Cards you’ve received.\n\nThis is also where you’ll find League Cards you\nreceived from other players!
The Battle Stadium
In the Battle Stadium, you can connect to other\nTrainers around the world to take part in Link Battles\nand various battle competitions against one another.
Casual Battles let you easily connect with all kinds\nof other players for battles—and for a bit of fun!\nYou might see some unexpected Pokémon and moves\nbeing used in these easygoing battles.
Ranked Battles are the real deal. This is where\nserious Trainers go to take one another on and try\nto reach the highest ranks. Your rank shows how strong\nyour team is, and it can go up and down based on\nthe results of your battles.
Online Competitions use a different system to measure\nyour skill as a Trainer. Here you earn a number rating\nthat shows where you stand among the competition.\nFor a fixed period of time, you’ll battle numerous other\nTrainers, and those battles will make your rating go up\nor down. Unlike other battle modes, it’s up to you to\nsearch out and select a competition you’ll choose to\ntake part in.
The Dynamax Phenomenon
In the Galar region, Pokémon can become far larger\nthan usual in certain places. This transformation is\ncalled “Dynamaxing.” Press the [VAR FF00(0006)]Dynamax button\n[VAR FF00(0000)]when your Dynamax Band lights up to Dynamax\nyour Pokémon.
Your Pokémon can only Dynamax for [VAR FF00(0006)]three turns[VAR FF00(0000)]!\nDuring that time, your Dynamax Pokémon can use\nextremely powerful moves known as [VAR FF00(0006)]Max Moves[VAR FF00(0000)].\nThese Max Moves not only deal tremendous damage—\nthey can also trigger special effects! The exact effect\nchanges depending on the type of the move used.\nChoose carefully when to Dynamax your Pokémon, and\nsmash your way to victory!
Pokémon Camp
In your Pokémon Camp, you and your Pokémon can\nplay together and even eat together, growing closer\nthrough the experience! If your Pokémon grow very\nclose to you, they may even try extra hard for you\nduring battle!
You can play using your Joy-Con, too! If you slide\nyour Joy-Con off your system, you can wave one\nabout to throw a ball for your Pokémon to retrieve\nor wave a Poké Toy for their delight. If you waggle\nthat Poké Toy, you might even entice Pokémon\nhanging out farther back in your camp to come play!
When you set up camp in the Wild Area, you’ll be\nable to play with up to three other Trainers at a time.\nAll kinds of people and Pokémon might stumble upon\nyour camp, even those you’ve never met before,\nso get to know them as you play together!
Cooking at Camp
Cook up a fine curry while out camping by selecting\ningredients and Berries of your liking!\n\nYour curries will get more delicious if you choose to\ndo things like using rare ingredients or adding lots\nof Berries, too.
Once you start cooking, fan the flames with your fan\nto keep things hot enough, and stir things up with your\nladle to keep ’em moving. Only don’t go overboard—\nyou don’t want to spill! The last step will be to add a\nbit of soul into it at just the right timing, and you’ll\nhave made a masterpiece for your Pokémon to enjoy!
After you finish cooking, it’ll be time for everyone to\ndig in together. Eating a tasty curry can have a number\nof effects on the Pokémon that are at your camp,\nincluding restoring their HP and making them feel\nmore friendly toward you!
[~ 34]
Pokémon Dens
The pillars of red light you’ll see in the Wild Area\nmark Pokémon Dens. Dynamax Pokémon dwell in\nthese dens, and you’ll be able to battle them by\ninvestigating the den. You can start the battle on your\nown or get up to three other players to help you out!
If you throw Wishing Chips into Pokémon Dens\nthat don’t have a light pillar, Dynamax Pokémon can\nappear in them, too!\n\nTry throwing a Wishing Chip into a Pokémon Den\nyou come across and see what happens!
You will also find Pokémon Dens that are glowing red\nbut do not have the light pillar. Checking these dens\nwill reward you with Watts!\n\nYou can give Watts to Trainers around the Wild Area\nto receive lots of different items.
Max Raid Battles
Defeat a Dynamax Pokémon, and you’ll get a chance\nat catching it!\n\nAdditionally, there are some rare items that you can\nonly obtain by battling Dynamax Pokémon!
When wild Pokémon Dynamax, they become\nincredibly powerful. They may unleash multiple moves\nin a row and take other actions you won’t see in a\nregular battle. Working together with other Trainers\nwill be key as you take on these Dynamax Pokémon\ntogether as a team of four.
The Flying Taxis
If you use the Flying Taxi service, one of their\nwell-trained Corviknight will have you zipping across\nthe Galar region to your desired destination in no\ntime at all! Just open up the X menu, and use the\nTown Map to choose where you want to go!
[~ 44]
Pokémon Boxes
You can keep extra Pokémon in your Pokémon Boxes.\nYou’ve got your own Boxes in the Pokémon storage\nsystem, which you can access at the Rotom Information\nterminals (Rotomi) found in Pokémon Centers\neverywhere. You can retrieve Pokémon from your\nBoxes at any Rotomi you visit, too!
Press the X Button to toggle between different modes\nso you can organize your Boxes more easily.\n\nYou can move Pokémon between your party and your\nBoxes, or sort the Pokémon in your Boxes based on\na number of different criteria.
Press the Y Button, and you can change what happens\nas you select Pokémon. The red cursor gives you\ndetailed options for a single Pokémon. The blue\ncursor lets you move or select a Pokémon easily.\nAnd the green cursor lets you outline a rectangular\narea so you can move several Pokémon at once.
[~ 49]
[~ 50]
[~ 51]
Poké Jobs
Pokémon are in high demand as helpers in the Galar\nregion, and you’re able to send your own Pokémon\nout to help out on jobs!\n\nThe Pokémon you send out will grow stronger from\nthe experience they gain!
The job postings will be updated every day.\nGood things will begin to happen if you send lots of\nPokémon to many jobs, so keep an eye out for new\npostings and help out as much as you can!
Job postings are updated just once a day, but as you\nget better evaluations, you’ll find that the number of\njob postings available will increase!\n\nSending a job requester lots of the type of Pokémon\nthey’re seeking will get you a great evaluation, so\nchoose Pokémon that are best suited to each job!
[~ 56]
The Gym Challenge
The Gym Challenge is an event in which aspiring\nTrainers travel around the Galar region to try to\ncollect Gym Badges from eight of its Gyms.\nTo earn a Gym Badge, you have to complete that\nGym’s mission and also defeat its Gym Leader.
Live Competitions
Live Competitions let you gather together with others\nand have competitions with one another.\n\nThese can be casual Friendly Competitions, which are\nhosted among friends, or Official Competitions.\n\nIf you want to find out about current or upcoming\nOfficial Competitions, check out Pokémon’s\nofficial website.
Hosting a Competition
Live Competitions can be hosted by anyone—\nincluding you!\n\nSet up the rules you’d like everyone to battle with,\nand then you can share them with all your competition\nparticipants using your system’s communication features!\n\nFor more information, head to Pokémon’s official website!
Casual Battles
Please observe the following rules when taking part in\nCasual Battles:\n\n• Battle Teams must be made up of [VAR FF00(0006)]six different Pokémon[VAR FF00(0000)].\n\n• No two Pokémon can [VAR FF00(0006)]hold the same item[VAR FF00(0000)].
You can take part in Casual Battles even with special\nPokémon in your Battle Team.\n\nEnjoy battles with all your favorite Pokémon!
Ranked Battles
Please observe the following rules when taking part in\nRanked Battles:\n\n• Battle Teams must be made up of [VAR FF00(0006)]six different Pokémon[VAR FF00(0000)].\n\n• No two Pokémon can [VAR FF00(0006)]hold the same item[VAR FF00(0000)].\n\n• Teams must not contain[VAR FF00(0006)] any special Pokémon[VAR FF00(0000)].
You’ll earn or lose points based on the results of your\nRanked Battles.\n\nOnce you’ve gained a certain number of points from\nyour Ranked Battles, you’ll go up in rank. On the other\nhand, if you lose enough points, you’ll go down in rank.
Ranks are sorted into different tiers. Once you reach\na new tier, you won’t fall back down into a lower tier,\neven if you lose in your Ranked Battles.\n\nFor example, once you’ve reached the Ultra Ball Tier,\nyou won’t fall back down into the Great Ball Tier,\nregardless of how many battles you lose.
Ranked Battles are held during set periods.\nEach of these set periods is called a season.\n\nOnce one season ends, a new season will begin.\n\nWhen a new season begins, all players will have their\nranks lowered. At this time only, you might find that\nyou’ve moved down a tier.
The players who reach the highest rank in Ranked\nBattles will no longer battle to reach a higher rank, but\ninstead to see where they place among the best.\n\nA Trainer’s place in the highest rank will go up or down\nbased on the results of their battles.
Online Competitions
Online Competitions can be broken down into two\ncategories: Official Competitions and\nFriendly Competitions.
In Official Competitions, you take part in special\nbattles with a variety of different rules and restrictions\nin order to see where you place.\n\nDetails about the schedule for these competitions and\nrestrictions on what Pokémon you can use in them are\nannounced on Pokémon’s official website.
Friendly Competitions are competitions that are held\nby players themselves. These are casual battles where\nplayers come together to battle one another.\n\nYou can try your hand at plenty of Friendly Competitions!
Search for an Official Competition or a\nFriendly Competition, and enter one to take\npart in battles once the competition begins.\n\nSearch out competitions with rules that sound like a\nfun challenge or that allow you to take part with the\nPokémon you like!
The Pokémon Box Link
You can use the Pokémon Box Link to access your\nPokémon Boxes while you’re on the road. You’ll be\nable to add Pokémon to your party or transfer\nPokémon from your party to a Box.\n\nYou can access your Boxes by selecting Pokémon from\nthe X menu and then pressing the R Button.
Information about Ranked Battles
Select VS from the menu and then select\nBattle Stadium to participate in Ranked Battles!\nHone your skills at the Battle Tower, and then give\nit a try!
Fishing
If you see shadows in the water, you’ll likely find\nPokémon lurking beneath them. Face such a shadow\nand press the A Button to cast your line and try to\nfish up a catch! If your Fishing Rod shakes, press\nthe A Button once more to reel in a Pokémon.\nTry fishing wherever you spot these shadows!
[~ 83]
Rental Teams
Rental Teams allow you to borrow other people’s\nBattle Teams that they’ve shared over the internet,\nor you can share your own team so other players can\nsee how great it is!\n\nWhen a team is shared, it will be given a team ID.\nInput that team ID when searching for a Rental Team,\nand you’ll be able to borrow the associated Battle Team!
The Isle of Armor
You have an Armor Pass!\nShow it to the rail staff at Wedgehurst Station if you\nwant to visit the Isle of Armor. You’ll be able to set\nout on a new adventure where you can catch rare\nPokémon and grow with your team!
The Crown Tundra
You have a Crown Pass!\nShow it to the rail staff at Wedgehurst Station if you\nwant to visit the Crown Tundra, a land where many\nmysteries lurk within. New adventures await there, and\nthe blanketing snow hides Legendary Pokémon of yore!
Dynamax Adventure
Form a team of four Trainers, and set off to explore\nthe mysterious Max Lair. See if you can find the\nLegendary Pokémon said to await you in the deepest\npart of this unusual den!
To take part in a Dynamax Adventure, you must\nborrow a single Pokémon to accompany you.\n\nGet things started by having each Trainer select the\nPokémon they will take with them on their adventure.
As you explore this den, you’ll come to branches in\nyour path. Decide as a team which way to go.\nWhen you come across a Dynamax Pokémon, it’ll be\ntime for a Max Raid Battle! Catch the Pokémon, and\nyou can swap it with the one you have if you think it’ll\nhelp you press on into the depths of the den.
The King of Bountiful Harvests
There’s a fairy tale in Freezington about the\nLegendary Pokémon known as the King of Bountiful\nHarvests. In the legends, the king is said to wear a\nmassive crown on its head, but the wooden statue\nnear the fields in the middle of the village shows no\nsign of a crown.
Calyrex appeared once I placed the crown on the\nstatue of the King of Bountiful Harvests.\nCalyrex can apparently speak to humans by taking\nover a person’s body—Peony’s, in this case. Now I\nneed to gather more information on the King of\nBountiful Harvests from the people of the village!
In order to find the king’s beloved steed, I’ll need\nto first get my hands on its favorite food—carrots.\nMaybe the people of Freezington can help me out.
Upon hearing that I was able to find Carrot Seeds,\nCalyrex told me about two fields where I can grow\nthe carrots. I need to pick either the field covered in\nsnow or the field by the graves and plant the seeds!
Calyrex was able to grow an Iceroot Carrot from the\nseeds I planted in the field covered in snow! The\nscent of the carrot lured Glastrier out, but it ran off\ntoward Freezington.
Calyrex was able to grow a Shaderoot Carrot from\nthe seeds I planted in the field by the graves! The\nscent of the carrot lured Spectrier out, but it ran off\ntoward Freezington.
Using the mane hair I got by defeating the Pokémon\nthat was once the king’s loyal steed along with the\nRadiant Petal grown by Calyrex itself, I was able\nto re-create the Reins of Unity!\nNow I need to head to the Crown Shrine, where the\nsteed’s been living, to meet up with Calyrex!
Calyrex, the King of Bountiful Harvests, was able\nto reconnect with its loyal steed using the new Reins\nof Unity. Calyrex also seems to have regained its\ntrust in humankind. As thanks for helping it regain its\npower, Calyrex is allowing me to take it along on\nmy adventure!
The Legendary Giants
Far, far into the Giant’s Bed lies a temple where the\ngiant of stone sleeps. On the temple’s door are\nstrange words:\n“Let the... ... ...mon h... ... ...chang... ... ....one.”\nThe door remains firmly shut.
Far, far into the Giant’s Bed lies a temple where the\ngiant of stone sleeps. On the temple’s door are\nstrange words:\n[VAR FF00(0006)]“Let the first Pokémon hold a never-changing stone.”\nWhen I gave my Pokémon an Everstone to hold, the\ndoor opened—and I found Regirock.[VAR FF00(0000)]
Sunken in the side of Snowslide Slope lies a temple\nwhere the giant of ice sleeps. On the temple’s door\nare strange words:\n“Wa... togeth... ... ...iving... ...stal... of sno...”\nThe door remains firmly shut.
Sunken in the side of Snowslide Slope lies a temple\nwhere the giant of ice sleeps. On the temple’s door\nare strange words:\n[VAR FF00(0006)]“Walk together with a living crystal of snow.”[VAR FF00(0000)]\n[VAR FF00(0006)]When I took a Cryogonal from its Poké Ball and had it\nwalk with me, the door opened—and I found Regice.[VAR FF00(0000)]
Near where green meets snow in the Giant’s Bed lies\na temple where the giant of steel sleeps. On the\ntemple’s door are strange words:\n“Let... ... out... ... ...note... ... wak... ... ...iant... ... ...eel.”\nThe door remains firmly shut.
Near where green meets snow in the Giant’s Bed lies\na temple where the giant of steel sleeps. On the\ntemple’s door are strange words:\n[VAR FF00(0006)]“Let ring out the piercing note that will wake the giant\nof steel.” When I whistled before the door, it\nopened—and I found Registeel.[VAR FF00(0000)]
On the distant paths of Three-Point Pass lies a temple\nwhere two giants sleep. On the temple’s door are\nstrange words:\n“Whe... ... ...ree ... ... ...door... ... ...all be ... ...ened.”\nThe door remains firmly shut.
On the distant paths of Three-Point Pass lies a temple\nwhere two giants sleep. On the temple’s door are\nstrange words:\n[VAR FF00(0006)]“When gather the three giants, the door of destiny\nshall be opened.” With the giants of stone, ice, and\nsteel gathered, the door opened—and I chose a giant.[VAR FF00(0000)]
The Bird Pokémon of Legend
When the sun reaches its zenith, it shines directly\ndown upon a great tree with leaves that seem to burn.\nIt is there that the legendary wings come to roost.
When the sun reaches its zenith, it shines directly\ndown upon a great tree with leaves that seem to burn.\nIt is there that the legendary wings come to roost.\n[VAR FF00(0006)]The bird of orange dashed off to the Wild Area.\nThe bird of black flew off to the Isle of Armor.\nThe bird of purple set off across the Crown Tundra.[VAR FF00(0000)]

[~ 90]
Reward
Dynite Ore
So, you’d like to take [VAR 0101(0000)] with you?
You’re fine without taking a new Pokémon home\nwith you after your adventure?
You handed over the Pokémon you’d rented and\nthe Pokémon you didn’t select to the scientist.\c

...The only reason I can battle in front of so many\npeople without completely losing my cool is\r\nthanks to you, Champion.\c\nBattles with you are so absorbing that they simply\nmake me forget myself or where I am.
I’ve got nothing to say. I’m here to win.
I’ve been crushed! I pride myself on my solid\nPokémon, and yet this...
Sorry to lose my cool...\nI’ll be sure to challenge you again.
So what are your top 10 favorite Pokémon?\c\n...That’s just how I break the ice. Are you ready\nfor a Pokémon battle now?
I think you took breaking the ice a little\ntoo literally...
It helps inspire my Gym Trainers if I participate\nin this tournament from time to time!\c\nMy only choice is to keep aiming for that\ngrand victory!
I’ll get the audience pumped up, even without\nusin’ Dynamax!
That’s it?! Piers doesn’t do encores, but I admit\nI’m tempted right now!
Battlin’ you makes me wanna try out a new\nbattle style. Maybe a Pokémon battle and a\r\ngig combined. What do you think, huh?\c\nCould sound battles be a thing?
I’m going to defeat the Champion, win the whole\ntournament, and prove to the world just how\r\nstrong the great Raihan really is!
I look this good even when I lose. It’s a real\ncurse. Guess it’s time for another selfie!
Considering how many likes the photos of my\ndefeats to you get, I bet a victory photo would\r\njust explode!\c\nWait... Have I got my priorities mixed up?
If I want people to properly respect me as the\nnew Spikemuth Gym Leader, I need to show\r\njust how amazin’ I am by defeatin’ you!
I mean, if you’re gonna win, you could at least\nwin in a way that makes me look good, right?
I’ve been losin’ to you since the Gym\nChallenge, and I’m gettin’ a bit fed up!\c\nYou’d better battle me again!
It’s time to prove I’m a notch above the\ncompetition to everyone in the Galar region.\r\nThough I suppose everyone should know by now.
Why did I have the misfortune of being born in\nthe same time period as you...?
If it weren’t for you, then I could prove beyond\ndoubt that I am the best...\c\nStill, I do enjoy my battles with you...to a degree.
I didn’t do as well in the Gym Challenge as I’d\nhoped, but...this tournament is different!\r\nYou’ll see!
That was not what I wanted!\nNo, no, no, no, no, no, no! NO!
I’m going to keep participating in this tournament\nuntil I’m satisfied! So you should keep coming,\r\ntoo, Champion!
I’m going to prove beyond doubt that Bug-type\nPokémon are strong and competitive!
Losing really bugs me!
I mean, there are different ways to be strong,\nright? I try not to let losing bring me down.\c\nPeople say I’ve got a tough spirit!
I’m going to soar to the highest point, just like\nthe Pokémon gracefully flying across the sky!
Oh no... Knocked down to the ground...
I’ll be flying again in no time!\nOnce I find a good air current...
My sponsor is here watching me today!\nI can’t have a pathetic battle!
Of all the days to lose, I lose today...
I get in trouble if I lose too much.\nThey say it damages the company’s brand.
Seeing you plow through the Gym Challenge was\na real inspiration for me...\r\nBut today, I came to win!
I think it’s always important to think about what\nyou can learn from your losses.
Thank you, Champion!\c\nI’ll use this experience to review how I battle\nand reevaluate my strategies.
I traveled all the way to the Kanto region to train\nmy karate!\c\nBehold the graceful moves of the Fighting Dojo!
My refined moves had no effect...\nYou’re just too amazing!
I’ve been told to start over every time I am\ndefeated, but to be honest I just wanted to\r\nbe with my Pokémon.
People think I’m edgy just because I love\nPoison-type Pokémon!
Losing doesn’t bother me, but I’m bummed that\nI couldn’t cover you in venom! Blaaah!
Poison can actually become medicine if it’s used\nproperly. Nothing edgy about it!
I prefer these tournaments over the Battle Tower.\nIt’s nice to have an audience!
Oh man, everyone just saw me get crushed...\nHow embarrassing!
I need to redeem myself! I’m gonna retrain my\nwhole team and make myself famous as a\r\nGhost-type user!
Even ice cannot be broken once it becomes\na glacier!
The strength I just showed you was only the tip\nof the iceberg!
I know, I know... If I can’t show it during matches,\nI can’t claim to have hidden strength.
I am grateful for this chance to defeat the\nChampion, even though the Gym Challenge\r\nis over!
Your Pokémon are so strong, it’s like I’m battling\nthe very land of the Galar region!
Now I know why I couldn’t beat you during the\nGym Challenge...\c\nBut I promise someday I will become strong—as\nstrong as the lands of Galar!
I’ll let the growth of plants overwhelm you!
Oh...\nI was overwhelmed.
Milo’s as stubborn as weeds, but...\nI still have a long way to go...
The Trainers of the Galar region need to give the\naudience a good show.\c\nThat means we need to show our strength!
Ele-shock! ...Huh? Oh, that means I’m shocked\nas an Electric-type user.
Even when I’m defeated, I try to give the match\nmy all and shock the audience in a good way!
I use powerful Dragon-type Pokémon.\nIf I’m not strong, then who is?
I couldn’t bring out the true strength of my\nDragon-type Pokémon...
I suppose a Trainer must be able to bring out the\ntrue potential of their Pokémon!
I’ve built my reputation by building up one win\nat a time. Think you can bring me down?
It only takes one defeat for everything I’ve built\nto come crashing down...
My pride was hard as steel too, but you really\npunched a hole through that.
So, I have a chance to battle the Champion?\nThis tournament’s a great deal!
Well, there goes the burning flame of\nmy ambition...
I guess all I got out of the tournament was a\nlesson on how strong the Champion is...
Don’t think I’m the same Milo as in the\nGym Challenge! You’re the great Champion,\r\nafter all. It’d be rude not to go all out!
The power of Grass has been wilted...\nYou’re quite the Champion!
Soon you’ll be the one to face down Gym\nChallengers aiming for your title.\r\nI can’t wait to see what talent grows!
Such strength! I’m in Psyshock!
Oh, my next Pokémon’s gonna make short work of—\nHuh? That was my last one?
That was everything I hoped for and more!
What a Psystrike to my poor pride...
Just what have you got that I don’t?
Oh, I could just Imprison myself for this!
But I didn’t hold back!\nI gave it everything I’ve got...
I have been swallowed whole by your\ngreat strength!
I did not get the chance to adapt!
Each one of your raindrops hit like a\nHydro Pump!
Your strength does not yield to cold or heat!
Light and dark aside, you have certainly\nbroadened my perspective!
Yes, even my strength perfected in light can be\novershadowed at times!
Now the darkness surrounds me... I am about\nto blackout!
It seems you have found your path and sailed right\non course!
You young folk grow so fast!\nIt never ceases to amaze me.
You young folk grow so fast!\nIt never ceases to amaze me.
Yeah I lost, but I’m gonna learn from your\nbattle style and everythin’!
Strength ebbs and flows in an endless cycle.\nOne moment you grasp it, and the next, it slips\r\nfrom your hand.\c\nBut the strength you now have—the strength that\nlet you defeat me—it is unwavering!\c\nCongratulations, from the bottom of my heart!
Strength ebbs and flows in an endless cycle.\nOne moment you grasp it, and the next, it slips\r\nfrom your hand.\c\nBut the strength you now have—the strength that\nlet you defeat me—it is unwavering!\c\nCongratulations, from the bottom of my heart!
Gone and got stronger again, have you? Ah well!\nHats off to you—in more ways than one!

If you rank high in a competition that will decide\nwho’ll be invited to a Live Competition held\nin Japan, you may be contacted by\nThe Pokémon Company via the email registered\nto your Nintendo Account.

Battle Tower
Single Battle
In this battle format, a Trainer sends out a single\nPokémon at a time against an opponent.
Double Battle
In this battle format, a Trainer sends out two\nPokémon at a time against an opponent’s two.

Here at the Battle Tower, we ask that all Trainers please\nobserve the following rules:\n\n• Battle Teams must be made up of [VAR FF00(0006)]six different Pokémon[VAR FF00(0000)].\n\n• No two Pokémon can [VAR FF00(0006)]hold the same item[VAR FF00(0000)].

Honey that Dynamax Vespiquen produces. Adding this\nhoney to Max Soup makes the taste very smooth. It also\nhas the same effect as a Max Revive.
Mushrooms that have the power of changing Dynamax\nforms. They boost all stats of a Pokémon during battle.
A twig from a species of tree called Galarica that grows\nin certain areas around the Galar region. It’s a material\nfor an accessory for a certain Pokémon.
A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.\nGiving it to Galarian Slowpoke makes the\nPokémon very happy.
A card that increases the selection in boutiques and\nhair salons.
A pass to go to the Isle of Armor. Show it to the rail\nstaff at Wedgehurst Station.
This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water\nusing Rotom’s power. It’s a sparkling white that\nshines brilliantly.
This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water\nusing Rotom’s power. It’s a glistening black that\nshines reddish-black.
A charm that increases the Exp. Points that Pokémon\ncan get. A machine-like object is inside the charm.
Rare ore that can be obtained on the Isle of Armor.\nSomething good will happen if you give it to a collector\non the Isle of Armor.
A mysterious and unique charm that increases the\nchance of finding a Pokémon with a mark.
Reins that people presented to the king. They enhance\nCalyrex’s power over bountiful harvests and unite\nCalyrex with its beloved steed.
Reins that people presented to the king. They enable\nthose who are connected to communicate with each\nother. The reins separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.
A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.\nPlacing it on the head of a Galarian Slowpoke makes\nthe Pokémon very happy.
A clue about the King of Bountiful Harvests. It’s written\nby Peony, and an old photo is attached to it.
A clue about the legend of giants. It’s written\nby Peony and has unique drawings.
A clue about the legend of bird Pokémon. It’s written\nby Peony and has a unique drawing.
A mysterious clue that Peony seems to have dropped.\nThere’s a photo attached to it showing a shining hole\nopening above the Max Lair.
A pass to go to the Crown Tundra. Show it to the rail\nstaff at Wedgehurst Station.
A mysterious object made of wood. Part of it seems to\nbe chipped. Maybe it’s meant to be part of something.
A single petal that the King of Bountiful Harvests\ngave you. It radiates faint light.
Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful\nHarvests’ beloved steed, Glastrier. The hair is strong\nand very flexible.
Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful\nHarvests’ beloved steed, Spectrier. The hair is very\nsmooth to the touch.
Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved\nsteed likes to eat. It grew in a field covered in snow.
Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved\nsteed likes to eat. It grew in a gloomy field.
Mysterious ore that can be obtained in the Max Lair.\nSomething good will happen if you give it to a\ncollector in the Crown Tundra.
Seeds to plant in a field. The kind of carrot you’ll get is\ndetermined by which field you plant the seeds in.
A patch that allows a Pokémon with a regular Ability\nto have a rare Ability.
Cords that shine when you hold them up to the light.\nThe people of old times presented these to the King of\nBountiful Harvests to express their gratitude.

Text File : waza_con
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Quite an appealing move.
A very appealing move, but after using this\nmove, the user is more easily startled.
A move of huge appeal, but using it prevents\nthe user from taking further contest moves.
An appealing move that can be used\nrepeatedly without boring the audience.
Prevents the user from being startled one time\nthis turn.
Prevents the user from being startled until the\nturn ends.
Startles the last Pokémon to act before\nthe user.
Startles all of the Pokémon to act before\nthe user.
Badly startles the last Pokémon to act before\nthe user.
Badly startles all of the Pokémon to act before\nthe user.
Makes the audience expect little of\nother contestants.
Badly startles Pokémon that the audience\nhas high expectations of.
Startles all other Pokémon. The user cannot act\non the next turn.
Badly startles Pokémon that used a move of\nthe same type.
Makes the remaining Pokémon nervous.
Brings down the energy of any Pokémon that\nhave already used a move this turn.
Works great if the user goes first this turn.
Works great if the user goes last this turn.
Shows off the Pokémon’s appeal about as\nwell as all the moves before it this turn.
Shows off the Pokémon’s appeal about as\nwell as the move used just before it.
Works better the later it is used in a turn.
Effectiveness varies depending on when it\nis used.
Works well if it is the same type as the move\nused by the last Pokémon.
Affected by how well the previous Pokémon’s\nmove went.
Gets the Pokémon pumped up.\nHelps prevent nervousness, too.
Works well if the user is pumped up.
Causes the user to move earlier on the\nnext turn.
Causes the user to move later on the\nnext turn.
Scrambles the order in which Pokémon will\nmove on the next turn.
Excites the audience in any kind of contest.
Badly startles all Pokémon that successfully\nshowed their appeal.
Works better the more excited the crowd is.
Temporarily stops the crowd from\ngrowing excited.
Excites the audience a lot if used first.
Excites the audience a lot if used last.
Makes the audience quickly grow bored when\nan appeal move has little effect.

Text File : btl_state
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[~ 0]
[~ 1]
Harsh Sunlight
The harsh sunlight weather condition.\nIt boosts the power of Fire-type moves and\nlowers the power of Water-type moves.
Rain
The rain weather condition.\nIt boosts the power of Water-type moves and\nlowers the power of Fire-type moves.
Sandstorm
The sandstorm weather condition.\nAt the end of each turn, it damages all Pokémon\nthat are not Rock, Ground, or Steel types.\nIt boosts the Sp. Def of Rock-type Pokémon.
Hail
The hail weather condition.\nAt the end of each turn, it damages all Pokémon\nthat are not Ice types.
Electric Terrain
For five turns, Pokémon on the ground won’t\nfall asleep.\nThe power of Electric-type moves is boosted.
Grassy Terrain
For five turns, Pokémon on the ground will have\na little HP restored at the end of each turn.\nThe power of Grass-type moves is boosted.
Misty Terrain
For five turns, Pokémon on the ground won’t get\nany status conditions.\nDamage from Dragon-type moves is halved.
Trick Room
Slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
Magic Room
Pokémon can’t use their held items for five turns.
Wonder Room
Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def are swapped for\nfive turns.
Critical Hit Boost
The Pokémon is more likely to land critical hits.
Confusion
The Pokémon may hurt itself in its confusion.\nThe effect lasts for one to four turns.
Infatuation
The Pokémon is less likely to unleash an attack\non Pokémon of the opposite gender.
Nightmare
The Pokémon will lose HP each turn as long as\nit is sleeping.
Drowsy
The Pokémon will fall asleep at the end of the\nturn if it remains on the battlefield.
Encore
Due to Encore, the Pokémon can use only\n[VAR 0107(0000)] for three turns.
No Ability
The Pokémon’s Ability loses its effect.
Torment
The Pokémon can’t use the same move twice\nin a row.
Tailwind
The Speed stats of a Pokémon and its allies are\ndoubled for four turns.
Lucky Chant
The opponent’s moves won’t result in a\ncritical hit.
Grudge
If the Pokémon faints by an opponent’s move,\nthe PP of that move will be reduced to 0.
Heal Block
For five turns, the Pokémon is unable to recover\nHP through its moves, Ability, or held item.
Identified
The Pokémon will be hit by certain moves\nthat usually wouldn’t affect it.\nIf the Pokémon’s evasiveness has been boosted,\nthe benefits will be ignored when it is attacked.
Move Disabled
For four turns, the Pokémon will be unable to\nuse [VAR 0107(0000)].
Can’t Escape
The Pokémon can’t flee or be switched out.
Lock-On
The next move used by the Pokémon will be sure\nto hit the target that was locked on to.
Embargo
For five turns, the Pokémon cannot use its held\nitem and no items can be used on it.
Charge
The power of an Electric-type move will be\ndoubled if used in the turn after charging.
Gravity
Moves are more likely to hit for five turns.\nGround-type moves will hit Flying-type\nPokémon and Pokémon with the Levitate Ability.\nMoves that require action midair can’t be used.
Mist
The Pokémon’s stats won’t be lowered for\nfive turns.
Safeguard
The Pokémon is protected from status conditions\nfor five turns.
Stealth Rock
Pokémon that switch into battle will\ntake damage.
Stockpile
The Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats\ngo up while stockpiling.
Taunt
The Pokémon can only use moves that\ndeal damage.
Telekinesis
For three turns, moves used against\nthe Pokémon will hit without fail, except for\none-hit KO moves.\nAlso, Ground-type moves won’t hit\nthe Pokémon.
Magnet Rise
Ground-type moves won’t hit the Pokémon\nfor five turns.
Toxic Spikes
Pokémon that switch into battle will\nbe poisoned.\nFlying-type Pokémon or Pokémon with\nthe Levitate Ability will not be affected.
Mud Sport
The power of Electric-type moves will be\nhalved for five turns.
Wish
The Pokémon in this spot will have its HP restored\non the turn after Wish was used.
Sticky Web
Pokémon that switch into battle will have their\nSpeed lowered.
Ingrain
The Pokémon regains some HP at the end of\neach turn.\nIngrained Pokémon can’t be switched out.
Curse
The Pokémon takes damage at the end\nof each turn.
Trick-or-Treat
The Pokémon gains the Ghost type.
Light Screen
Damage from special moves is halved for\nfive turns.
Reflect
Damage from physical moves is halved for\nfive turns.
Imprison
If a Pokémon affected by Imprison knows any\nmoves also known by the user of Imprison, it is\nprevented from using those moves.
Counting Down
All Pokémon in this battle state will faint after\nthree turns.
Spikes
Pokémon that switch into battle will\ntake damage.\nFlying-type Pokémon or Pokémon with\nthe Levitate Ability will not be affected.
Water Sport
The power of Fire-type moves will be\nhalved for five turns.
Destiny Bond
If the Pokémon is knocked out by an opponent,\nthat opponent will also faint.
Forest’s Curse
The Pokémon gains the Grass type.
Leech Seed
Leech Seed steals some of the Pokémon’s HP\nat the end of each turn and gives it to\nthe opponent.
Lock-On
Any move used against a locked-on target will\nbe sure to hit.
Bound
The Pokémon is bound and takes damage\nevery turn.
Bide
The Pokémon endures attacks for two turns,\nthen strikes back to inflict double the\ndamage it has taken.
Outrage
The Pokémon rampages and attacks for two to\nthree turns. It then becomes confused.
Rampaging
The Pokémon rampages and attacks for two to\nthree turns. It then becomes confused.
Petal Dance
The Pokémon rampages and attacks for two to\nthree turns. It then becomes confused.
Badly Poisoned
The Pokémon is badly poisoned. The damage\nthe Pokémon takes from the poison worsens\nevery turn.
Future Attack
The Pokémon will take damage two turns after\nan attack was foreseen.
Uproar
The Pokémon attacks and causes an uproar for\nthree turns. During this time, no Pokémon can\nfall asleep.
Aqua Ring
The Pokémon is enveloped in a veil made of\nwater. It regains some HP every turn.
Autotomize
The Pokémon’s weight is reduced, and its Speed\nis sharply increased.
Smack Down
The Pokémon has been knocked out of the sky\nand has fallen to the ground.
Fairy Lock
No Pokémon can flee the turn after Fairy Lock\nis used.
Rainbow
The additional effects of moves are more likely\nto occur.
Swamp
Speed is reduced by 75% in swampy conditions.
Sea of Fire
Pokémon that are not Fire types will\ntake damage every turn.
Extremely Harsh Sunlight
The extremely harsh sunlight weather condition.\nIt boosts the power of Fire-type moves and\nprotects Pokémon from Water-type moves.
Heavy Rain
The heavy rain weather condition.\nIt boosts the power of Water-type moves and\nprotects Pokémon from Fire-type moves.
Strong Winds
The strong winds weather condition.\nThe power of moves that are super effective\nagainst Flying-type Pokémon is decreased.
Psychic Terrain
For five turns, Pokémon on the ground won’t be\nhit by priority moves.\nThe power of Psychic-type moves is boosted.
Throat Chop
The Pokémon can’t use any sound-based moves\nfor two turns.
Aurora Veil
For five turns, the power of special and physical\nmoves will be halved.
Laser Focus
The next move used will always result in\na critical hit.
Tar Shot
The Pokémon has been made weaker to\nFire-type moves.
Octolock
The Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def are both\nlowered with each passing turn.
G-Max Wildfire
Pokémon that are not Fire types will take\ndamage every turn for four turns.
G-Max Volcalith
Pokémon that are not Rock types will take\ndamage every turn for four turns.
G-Max Steelsurge
Pokémon that switch into battle will\ntake damage.
G-Max Vine Lash
Pokémon that are not Grass types will take\ndamage every turn for four turns.
G-Max Cannonade
Pokémon that are not Water types will take\ndamage every turn for four turns.

Text File : gwazainfo
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
A Fire-type attack that Gigantamax Charizard use.\nThis move continues to deal damage to opponents\nfor four turns.
A Bug-type attack that Gigantamax Butterfree use.\nThis move inflicts the poisoned, paralyzed, or\nasleep status condition on opponents.
An Electric-type attack that Gigantamax Pikachu use.\nThis move paralyzes opponents.
A Normal-type attack that Gigantamax Meowth use.\nThis move confuses opponents and also earns\nextra money.
A Fighting-type attack that Gigantamax Machamp use.\nThis move raises the chance of critical hits.
A Ghost-type attack that Gigantamax Gengar use.\nThis Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s shadow\nto prevent them from escaping.
An Ice-type attack that Gigantamax Lapras use.\nThis move reduces the damage received for five turns.
A Normal-type attack that Gigantamax Eevee use.\nThis move infatuates opponents.
A Normal-type attack that Gigantamax Snorlax use.\nThis move restores Berries that have been eaten.
A Poison-type attack that Gigantamax Garbodor use.\nThis move poisons opponents.
A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Drednaw use.\nThis move scatters sharp rocks around the field.
A Flying-type attack that Gigantamax Corviknight use.\nThis move removes the effects of moves like Reflect and\nLight Screen.
An Electric-type attack that Gigantamax Toxtricity use.\nThis move poisons or paralyzes opponents.
A Fairy-type attack that Gigantamax Alcremie use.\nThis move heals the HP of allies.
A Dragon-type attack that Gigantamax Duraludon use.\nReduces the PP of the last move used.
A Psychic-type attack that Gigantamax Orbeetle use.\nThis move changes gravity for five turns.
A Rock-type attack that Gigantamax Coalossal use.\nThis move continues to deal damage to opponents\nfor four turns.
A Ground-type attack that Gigantamax Sandaconda use.\nOpponents are trapped in a raging sandstorm for\nfour to five turns.
A Dark-type attack that Gigantamax Grimmsnarl use.\nThe user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the targets\ninto falling asleep on the next turn.
A Grass-type attack that Gigantamax Flapple use.\nThis move reduces the opponents’ evasiveness.
A Grass-type attack that Gigantamax Appletun use.\nThis move heals the status conditions of allies.
A Fairy-type attack that Gigantamax Hatterene use.\nThis move confuses opponents.
A Steel-type attack that Gigantamax Copperajah use.\nThis move scatters sharp spikes around the field.
A Steel-type attack that Gigantamax Melmetal use.\nThis move makes opponents incapable of using the\nsame move twice in a row.
A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Kingler use.\nThis move harshly lowers the Speed of opponents.
A Fire-type attack that Gigantamax Centiskorch use.\nThis move traps opponents in flames for four to\nfive turns.
A Grass-type attack that Gigantamax Venusaur use.\nThis move continues to deal damage to opponents\nfor four turns.
A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Blastoise use.\nThis move continues to deal damage to opponents\nfor four turns.
A Grass-type attack that Gigantamax Rillaboom use.\nThis move can be used on the target regardless of\nits Abilities.
A Fire-type attack that Gigantamax Cinderace use.\nThis move can be used on the target regardless of\nits Abilities.
A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Inteleon use.\nThis move can be used on the target regardless of\nits Abilities.
A Dark-type attack that Gigantamax Urshifu use.\nThis single-strike move can ignore Max Guard.
A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Urshifu use.\nThis rapid-strike move can ignore Max Guard.

Text File : tokuseiinfo
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
-
By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon\nmay cause the target to flinch.
The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.
Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.
Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO\nmoves cannot knock it out, either.
Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as\nSelf-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings.
Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in a sandstorm.
The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so\ncontact with it may cause paralysis.
Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead\nof taking damage.
Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of\ntaking damage.
The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from\nbeing infatuated or falling for taunts.
Eliminates the effects of weather.
The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.
The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot\nfall asleep.
The Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the move\nused on it.
The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from\ngetting poisoned.
Powers up the Pokémon’s Fire-type moves if it’s hit\nby one.
This Pokémon’s dust blocks the additional effects of\nattacks taken.
This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents\nit from becoming confused.
This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot\nto negate all moves and items that force\nswitching out.
The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon\nentering battle, lowering their Attack stat.
This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s\nshadow to prevent it from escaping.
This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin\nto the attacker on contact.
Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves\nhit the Pokémon.
By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full\nimmunity to all Ground-type moves.
Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep,\nor paralysis on its attacker.
The attacker will receive the same status condition if\nit inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.
Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from\nlowering the Pokémon’s stats.
All status conditions heal when the Pokémon\nswitches out.
The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.\nInstead of being hit by Electric-type moves,\nit boosts its Sp. Atk.
Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring\nwhen attacking.
Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.
Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by\nilluminating the surroundings.
When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an\nopposing Pokémon’s Ability.
Doubles the Pokémon’s Attack stat.
Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
The Pokémon’s intensely focused, and that protects\nthe Pokémon from flinching.
The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which\nprevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.
The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which\nprevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using\nits magnetic force.
Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full\nimmunity to all sound-based moves.
The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.
The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters\na battle.
By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it\nraises their PP usage.
The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat,\nwhich halves the damage taken from Fire- and\nIce-type moves.
The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast\nas other Pokémon.
Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.
Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this\nPokémon’s accuracy.
The Pokémon’s proud of its powerful pincers. They\nprevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing\nPokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items\noutside of battle, too.
The Pokémon can’t use a move if it had used a move\non the previous turn.
Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.
Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.
Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally\nwith the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally\nwith the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.
The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change\nits type to Water, Fire, or Ice.
Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and\ncannot be removed by other Pokémon.
The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions\nby shedding its skin.
It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts\nthe Pokémon’s Attack stat.

Text File : zukan_comment_A
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

There is a plant seed on its back right from the\nday this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly\ngrows larger.
When the bulb on its back grows large, it\nappears to lose the ability to stand on its\nhind legs.
Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar\nenergy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
It has a preference for hot things. When it rains,\nsteam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its\nfiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders.\nIt may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it\nsquirts out water with vigorous force.
It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its\nshell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause\nfainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
For protection, it releases a horrible stench from\nthe antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this\nstage, it can only harden, so it remains\nmotionless to avoid attack.
In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to\nrelease highly toxic dust into the air.












Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity\nhave cheek sacs that are extra soft and\nsuper stretchy.
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself\nfrom its own high-voltage power.
It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas.\nBy sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt\nand moisture clinging to its body.
The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder\nand smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel\nwhen touched.
Females are more sensitive to smells than males.\nWhile foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check\nwind direction and stay downwind of predators.
The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought\nthat this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get\npoked while their mother is feeding them.
Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense.\nWith scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield\nits children from any kind of attack.
The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains\na powerful poison. This is a very cautious\nPokémon, always straining its large ears.
With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this\nPokémon goes around shattering boulders as it\nsearches for a moon stone.
When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to\ncontrol. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s\nlived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
It is said that happiness will come to those who\nsee a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a\nfull moon.
A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will\nrun and hide the moment it senses people.
While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it\ngrows, several new tails are sprouted.
It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails\nis loaded with supernatural powers.
Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by\ncomparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop\nsinging its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If\nopponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate\nitself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check\nits surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies\naround with skill.
It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said\nthat if it finds others of its kind going hungry,\nit sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move.\nIt roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor.\nThe horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance\nof 1.25 miles.
It has the world’s largest petals. With every step,\nthe petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.




If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil\nperfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge\nearthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good\nmood, it might even let its Trainer have a look\nat its hoard of treasures.
Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you\ntakes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the\nmoment it gets annoyed.
Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the\nPokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently\nthe pain subsides for a while.
This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It\npaddles through the water with its long limbs,\nputting its graceful swimming skills on display.


It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly\nstands up to bigger and stronger foes.
The sight of it running over 6,200 miles\nin a single day and night has captivated\nmany people.
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.\nThe swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of\nthe Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.\nThis trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of\nlullabies to get children to go to sleep.
Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through\ncold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to\nsmash through drift ice and plow forward.
This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it\nsleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the\npowers that the Pokémon wields.
Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it\nsleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
It has an incredibly high level of intelligence.\nSome say that Alakazam remembers everything\nthat ever happens to it, from birth till death.
Its whole body is composed of muscles.\nEven though it’s the size of a human child, it can\nhurl 100 grown-ups.
Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a\npower-save belt to be able to regulate\nits motions.
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its\nopponents with ceaseless punches and chops\nfrom all angles.



Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer.\nIt drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it\nsearches for prey.
When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow\nbrightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to\nfire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.



It can’t run properly when it’s newly born.\nAs it races around with others of its kind,\nits legs grow stronger.

Text File : pokecamp_cookinfo
