The aroma of the Galar masala tickles the nose\nin this extremely simple, basic curry.
The aroma of the Galar masala brings out the\nsimple spiciness in this extremely basic curry.
The aroma of the Galar masala makes the\nstrong dryness prominent in this basic curry\nthat many can enjoy.
The aroma of the Galar masala is accented by\nthe strong sweetness. A curry that anyone\ncan enjoy.
The aroma of the Galar masala greatly brings\nout the bitterness in this extremely simple curry.
The aroma of the Galar masala mellows out\nthe acidity in this truly simple curry.
The taste of the boiled sausage really comes out\nin this curry thanks to the simple seasoning.
The spicy seasoning of the curry roux really\nbrings out the umami of the sausage.
The oil from the sausage softens the dry taste of\nthe curry roux. It’s quite easy for anyone to eat.
The sausage’s umami and the sweet curry\nroux come together in a perfect match in this\nrefined dish.
The texture of the sausage and the bitter curry\nroux make for a good match. This is a curry that\nadults often enjoy.
The striking acidic taste of the curry roux and\nthe rich umami of the sausage really stimulate\nthe appetite.
The contents of Bob’s tin bring with them an\nunexpected volume and richness that one can\nreally enjoy in this curry.
A meeting of the spicy seasoning and the\neffective punch of the tinned foods have united\nto create a miracle.
A happy harmony between the dry flavor and oil.\nMen and women of any age can enjoy the safe\nand stable flavor.
It seems like a mismatch, but the combination is\nboth rich and smooth, creating something\nbeyond compare.
Within the rich wave of oil, the bitter notes of the\ncurry roux are faint, but they provide an\nundeniable presence.
The acidic taste suppresses the peculiar flavor of\nthe ingredients, successfully only drawing out\nthe umami.
A precious curry made using Bach’s Food Tin,\nwhich are said to have never even left the\ntop shelf.
The strong umami in the tinned foods and the\nspicy seasoning in the curry roux are spoken of as\nan incredible combination.
The curry roux’s refreshing dry flavor brings out\nthe rich taste of the tinned foods all the more in\nthis curry.
With strong sweetness and profound richness, this\nis a dish that anyone who considers themselves a\ncurry connoisseur should eat.
The umami is so strong it practically numbs\nthe tongue. The bitter flavoring strongly brings\nout the taste of the ingredients.
The acidic seasoning of the curry roux coats the\ntinned foods to create something you could\neat again and again, and yet never tire of.
The by-the-book curry roux and the properly\nboiled beans together create a rather\nsimple taste.
The curry roux’s strongly spicy taste and the\nnatural sweetness of the beans create an\nenjoyable contrast.
A dry tasting curry roux and the light umami of\nthe beans form a simple taste, but it’s one you\nwon’t get tired of eating.
This curry has a sweet flavor, but this sweetness\nis mellowed by the simple taste of the added\nbeans to create a flavor with some depth.
The bitterness of the curry roux neutralizes the\ntaste of the beans. Even those who hate beans\ncan enjoy this dish.
The pleasant texture of the beans and the acidic\ncurry roux play off each other in delightful harmony.
Even if you don’t like the idea of eating two\nkinds of carbs, they’re quite filling.\nIt’s an extremely amateurish meal.
Surprisingly, the haphazard placement of the\ntoast and the spicy curry roux make for a dish\nwith a crunch that just won’t quit.
Tear up the toast first, then mix it in with the\ncurry roux to make the bitter flavor more mild\nand easier to eat.
Put the sweet curry roux on the savory toast like\njam, then enjoy a taste that’s curiously delicious.
A dish where the flavor of the well-browned and\nroasted toast makes for a mysterious match with\nthe bitter curry roux.
The fluffy texture of the toast paired with the\nacidic seasoning of the curry roux gives it a\ncertain profoundness.
A dish where one can enjoy curry with rice and\ncurry with pasta all at the same time. Best to eat\nit when you’re feeling really hungry.
It’s recommended that you mix up the dish before\neating it to get the most out of the spicy flavor.
Even a dry taste matches well with the pasta.\nEnjoy both carbs—the rice and the pasta.
It has a great taste despite how it looks.\nThe even, sweet curry goes well with both\nthe rice and the pasta.
The spices, with their strong bitter notes, are\nrich enough that you really want the pasta as\nwell to help balance them out.
Recommended for when you really want to eat\nsome pasta, too. The strong, acidic curry roux\nkeeps you eating to the last bite.
The umami of the various mushrooms seeps\ninto the sauce, creating a dish that’s a step\nabove most others.
The trick to bringing out the umami of the\nmushrooms is to make the spicy curry roux as\nstriking as you can.
The combined flavors of the various mushrooms\nhelps to make the dry flavor of the curry roux\nmore mild.
The crisp mushrooms, clad in sweet curry roux,\nmake for a pleasant texture.
The inclusion of the mushrooms makes the bitter\ntaste of this one-of-a-kind curry into an even-\nstronger sensation.
The rich mushrooms and acidic flavor of the curry\nroux are a complex sensation, but create an\numami aftertaste that leaves you wanting more.
A classic dish for any cook. The tail’s umami\nputs the curry roux in a rank above.
The sharp bite of the spicy curry roux helps with\nthe overpowering heaviness of the tail, making it\neasier to eat.
A happy union between the juicy tail and the dry\ncurry roux. It’s a first-rate dish.
The prominent sweet seasoning matches well\nwith the fragrance of the tail. The aroma is a\ndish all on its own.
The fat dripping from the tail makes the bitter\ncurry roux milder. It’s a dish with a profound taste.
The acidity of the curry roux helps to balance\nthe tail’s unique flavor. Truly a dish that’s quite\neasy to enjoy.
Its charm is in its overwhelming volume. The basic\nseasoning does little to dull the flavor of the leek.
The fruit-like sweetness of the savory grilled\nleek creates an exquisite balance with\nthe spicy curry roux.
The juices of the leek have permeated the curry\nroux, lending its dry flavor even greater depths.
The leek is the main feature of this curry.\nThe sweetness of the curry roux does little more\nthan bring out the umami of the leek.
The fresh sweetness of the leek makes the\ncurry roux’s bitter flavor all the more vivid.
The striking sweetness of the leek amid the\nstrongly acidic bite of the sauce makes this a\ntruly invigorating dish.
A class of curry that is most assuredly sweet.\nIt’s not for everyone, but it’s quite addictive for\nthose who like it.
The sweet apple and the spicy seasoning of the\ncurry roux create an unexpectedly enjoyable\nharmony in this dish.
The sweet and sour taste of the apple take the\nedge off the dry curry roux to make this a dish\nthat’s extraordinarily easy for anyone to eat.
The meeting of sweet curry roux and sweet apple.\nThe sweetness strikes the tongue and heart so\nprofoundly, it leaves you feeling almost numb.
From within the bitter seasoning, a faint\nreverberating sweetness that seeped from the\napple remains.
The sourness of the apple accentuates the acidic\nbite of the curry roux to create a bracing flavor.
The flavors imparted by simmering the bone add\ndepth to the curry roux, yet the flavor remains\nclean and delicious.
The flavors imparted by simmering the bone\nreally play up the spicy seasoning that’s been\nadded to the sauce.
The umami and richness from the bone mix into\nthe dry curry roux to form a highly elegant flavor.
The rich flavor extracted from the bone isn’t\noutshone by the sweet curry roux . The\naftertaste is exquisite!
The flavor is so savory and rich, it even obscures\nthe bitter notes in the curry roux. This is the power\nof using such a top-shelf bone as an ingredient.
The rich and savory flavor extracted from the\nbone and the acidic tang flavoring the sauce\nmake this a dish with a pleasing aftertaste.
This basic and delicious curry is filled with\npieces of soft and flaky potato.
A dish where you can really enjoy the potatoes.\nYou’ll never tire of the spiciness, and those who\nlike potatoes won’t be able to stop their spoons.
Bite into these potatoes, thickly coated in the\ndry curry roux. There you’ll find a deliciousness\nthat needs no words.
The simple tastiness of the potatoes brings out\nthe sweet seasoning of the curry roux in this\nwonderful dish.
The bitter seasoning of the curry roux and the\nsimple sweetness of potatoes—truly a\nsuperior combination.
The potatoes are purposely left unseasoned.\nEnjoy mixing them in with the acidic seasoning\nof the curry roux.
The spice of the root provides this simple curry\nroux with a delightful accent—and can clear out\nyour sinuses!
The refreshing spice of the root, the deep spicy\nheat of the curry roux—this is a must try for\nthose that love spicy food.
The flavor of the root makes the somewhat\nheavy dryness of the curry roux more invigorating.\nTruly an easy dish for many to enjoy.
The refreshing spiciness and aroma of the root\nis made all the more enjoyable by the\nsweet seasoning.
The striking aroma of the root makes for a good\npair with the bitter curry roux. A taste that’s\nsomewhat more for adults.
The peculiar aroma of the curry is irresistible\nwhen paired with the sour curry roux. A curry for\nthose who call themselves curry aficionados.
The many vegetables give the curry roux a\nmellow sweetness. This is a very healthy dish.
Adding the spicy flavor has drawn out the\numami in the vegetables, bringing about a\nprofound taste.
The sweetness and richness of the vegetables\nsoftens the dry taste of the curry roux, making\nthis dish actually quite easy for many to eat.
The essence of the vegetables has dissolved into\nthe sweet seasoning of the curry roux, giving it a\nprofound umami.
The distinct, bitter seasonings are accented\nwell by the sweet flavor of the vegetables.
The strong acidic taste of the curry roux and the\nsweet taste of the vegetables make for a\nharmonious balance in this dish.
The hearty fried foods and the spicy curry roux\nmake for a good match, though it weighs a bit\nheavily on the stomach.
The fried foods are covered in a thick crust and\nsoaked in oil. It’s enough to overpower even\nthe spicy seasoning.
The fried foods are cloaked in a thick layer of\noil. Even the dry seasoning has been dulled.
The combination of the oily fried food with\na sweet curry roux is... Well, let’s just say it’s an\nacquired taste.
There’s so much oil from the fried foods that it\nerases the bitter taste of the curry roux. A dish\nwith a lot of calories.
The distinct acidity of the seasonings help\nmitigate the oiliness of the fried foods, allowing\nyou to finish this dish without getting tired of it.
In a word, superb. The spicy curry roux brings\nout the tastiness of the egg.
The spicy taste of the curry roux helps to bring\nout the abundant umami in the egg. One of\nthe ultimate curries.
The dry seasoning brings out the sweetness of\nthe egg. It’s hard to go wrong with this dish.
The sweet taste of the curry roux truly pairs with\nthe richness of the egg. A dish with the power to\nmove one’s emotions.
A popular dish among gourmands. Breaking the\negg and eating it with the curry roux changes the\nbitter taste to a more rich one.
The distinct acidic seasoning pairs quite well\nwith the egg whites. So delicious it’ll practically\nmake you howl.
With one bite of the fruits and one sip of the\nspicy curry roux, you’ll swear you felt the breeze\nof a southern tropical island.
The fruits are sweet and juicy. They give the\nspicy curry roux a pleasant accent.
The distinct dry seasoning draws out the\nunique sweetness of the fruits all the more in\nthis curry.
The sweetness of the fruits seeps completely\ninto the curry roux, making it exceedingly sweet.
The vivid sweetness of the fruits and the curry roux’s\nbitter taste make an unexpectedly good match.
The peculiar sweetness of the fruits and the\nstrong, acidic seasoning make this a unique curry,\none you’ll make a habit of eating.
The melted cheese gives the curry a strong\nrichness. This is a curry that’s popular\nwith women.
The richness and sweetness of the cheese make\nthe spicy flavor more mild. This is a curry with a\ngood taste.
Freely cover this dish in cheese. The more there\nis, the more it brings out the delicious,\ndry seasoning.
The richness of the cheese strongly brings out\nthe sweet taste of the curry roux. This is a curry\nthat’s perfect for anyone with a sweet tooth.
The trick to preparing this dish is to not hold\nback when adding the cheese. It changes the curry\nroux’s bitter taste to something more profound.
The acidity of the curry roux and the cheese’s\nsweetness create a distinct taste that’s hard\nto stop eating once you’ve started.
A strongly seasoned, stimulating, spiced dish.\nTruly a curry for the curry lover.
Over fifty different kinds of spices create a very\ncomplex flavor. The spicy heat is quite good.
Thanks to the potent dry seasoning, the richness\nand aroma of the spices is quite prominent in\nthis curry.
Though this curry has a kick to it, it’s still easy to\neat. The peculiar flavor of the spices is mitigated\nby the sweet curry roux.
The profound bitterness together with the kick\nof the spices creates an engrossing flavor.
The savory aroma of the spices creates a splendid\nharmony with the distinctly sour-tasting curry roux.
Thanks to the cream, this is a curry with quite a\nmild taste. A dish that even young kids will\neasily enjoy.
A strange accent is created from the pairing of\nthe abundantly sweet cream and the\nspicy seasoning.
The cream’s richness gives the dry seasoned\ncurry roux a nuanced umami.
The addition of the cream has made the sweet curry\nroux even sweeter. It’s practically a dessert now.
Mixing in the cream has made the bitter curry\nroux more mild. An unexpectedly tasty dish.
The acidic flavor is masked in the tasty sweetness\nof the cream. This curry has a great balance.
An improper curry that casts aside taste in\nfavor of looking cute. It’s ideal for taking\npictures to share.
Despite it’s cute look, the curry roux is overly\nspicy. This dish’s appearance and taste are at\ncomplete odds.
The intense dry taste isn’t too pleasing, but the\ncute decorations are truly captivating. This is a\ncurry for a truly niche audience.
The curry’s cute appearance and the rich, sweet\nflavor of the curry roux make this dish very\npopular with young children.
You wouldn’t suspect it from how it looks, but\nthis dish is bitter enough to make water taste\nsweet by comparison.
In contrast to how it looks, it’s got a strange,\nsour taste. It fills you with a mysterious feeling\nwhen you eat it.
The milk’s sweetness and richness raise this curry\nto a stage above most others.
The spicy curry roux and the sweet milk are a\nperfect match. An unbelievably superb dish.
The fine sweetness of the milk paired with the\ndry taste of the curry roux changed to create a\nmagnificent umami.
It’s certainly a sweet curry. However, the\nsweetness comes from the milk, so you can eat\nthis curry without it being sickening.
The sweetness and richness of the milk makes\nthe bitter curry roux taste great. The very\ndefinition of a witty taste.
A dish quite popular among young folks. The\nacidic seasoned curry roux pairs excellently with\nthe sweetness of the milk.
When the instant noodles and the curry were\ncombined, they became exactly what you’d\nexpect—junk food.
A taste preferred by young people. The spicy\ncurry roux and the instant noodles create an\nunexpectedly good match.
When the dry tasting curry roux and the\ninstant noodles intermix, they evolve to\ncreate a deliciousness that’s a rank above.
The artificial flavor of the instant noodles\nactually makes for a pretty good pair with the\nsweet tasting curry roux.
The strong, bitter seasoning helps to transform\nthe taste of the instant noodles into\nsomething more genuine.
The powerful acidic taste of the curry roux\nmakes up for the lackluster instant noodles,\nmaking this dish pretty tasty.
Breaking up the burger into the curry, mixing it,\nand eating it that way creates a supereffective taste.
The spicy curry roux and the juicy burger form\na combination that’ll keep your spoon moving.
Though the burger has a lot of oil, the curry\nroux’s dry flavor keeps the dish light and easy\nfor anyone to eat.
A dish with an acquired taste. The sweet curry\nroux and burger make for a very strong character.
The burger’s oil and the bitter seasoning make\na great pair. It’s hard to go wrong with this dish.
The acidic curry roux has a kick to it that really\nbrings out the umami of the burger, making a\ndelicious meal.
This curry lives up to its Gigantamax name with\nits overflowing umami taste.

Text File : pokecamp_kinomiinfo
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
A simple Berry that’s easy to use even for novice cooks.\nIts spicy hot taste is addictive.
A Berry whose subtle dryness is known for going\nvery well with greasy ingredients.
A Berry that’s easy to get and often used for cooking.\nIt’s very popular for its refreshing sweetness.
A Berry that’s used as a secret ingredient for cooking\nbecause its slight bitterness adds a kick to any dish.
A Berry that gives off a sour fragrance when you bite it.\nUsing a lot of them adds a light aftertaste to a dish.
A fun Berry that’s full of different flavors.\nIt’s easy to eat because it doesn’t have a dry taste.
A Berry that’s an acquired taste, since it has no\nsweetness. It adds a distinctive flavor if it’s used\nfor cooking.
A Berry with a unique flavor. It doesn’t have a dry\ntaste, so it’s actually easy to use for cooking.\nA ripe Persim Berry has a bright color.
A Berry that has a well-balanced flavor, although it\nlacks sourness. It has a lot of nutrients that are good\nfor Pokémon.
A Berry that can be used for anything because it’s not\nspicy and everyone can eat it.
A Berry with a distinctive shape. It’s filled with\nspicy components.
A Berry with bumps that are full of sour flavor.\nYou can enjoy its texture, too.
A Berry that’s easy to eat raw and perfect for a quick\ntreat. The curvier the Berry is, the sweeter it is.
A Berry with a bitter flavor that grows more pronounced\nnear the stem. Slow cooking brings out the depth in\nits flavor.
A big Berry that’s full of sourness and water inside.
A Berry with sweet and spicy flesh. If you keep chewing\nit, its bitterness will slowly spread in your mouth.
A Berry that can be eaten raw. But if you cook them\ndown, the juices you extract will bring out the flavor of\nany dish.
A Berry with a spicy skin. But its flesh has a sweet\nfragrance, which stimulates everyone’s appetite.
A Berry with an unusual taste, but many people like it.\nWhen its yellow parts are bulging, the Berry is ripe.
A Berry that’s good for salad. If you chew it slowly, its\nsourness and sweetness will spread in your mouth in\na perfect harmony.
A Berry that’s so spicy that your mouth turns red.\nYou could enjoy a scorchingly hot meal by combining\nthis Berry with spices.
A Berry that is hard and spicy, but heating it up will\nincrease its sweetness. It’s perfect for a meal with\na strong flavor.
A dry Berry, as you can guess from its appearance.\nIts soft flesh easily breaks down, melding into liquid\nto bring out the flavor of a meal.
A pretty-looking yellow Berry. Its sour-sweet flavor\nand cute appearance are perfect for sweets. Jam\nmade of these Berries is also delicious.
A Berry that many adults eat as a dessert.\nIts bitter flavor is imbued with a subtle spiciness that\nlingers in your mouth.
A refreshing Berry with dry and sour flavors. Eating a\nchilled Yache Berry cools your heated body.
A Berry with a substance that generates heat in its\nflesh. It’s invaluable in cold areas.
A Berry with a brilliant green color on the outside.\nThat part is sour, but inside, the Berry is packed\nwith dry-flavored, black-colored flesh.
A Berry with sweetness-laden pulp. It’s delicious as is,\nbut heating it up brings out a pleasant aroma.
A Berry that’s hard and bitter. It’s blue in color, and\nchewing it makes your tongue bright blue.
A Berry with a sweet flavor and juicy fragrance.\nThe rounder the Berry swells, the sweeter and juicier\nit gets.
A Berry with a very spicy flavor. If you’re not careful and\nuse a lot of these Berries, you’ll have a spicy hot dish.
A Berry that’s often used for pickles because of its\ndry flavor. Boiling them down makes them quite soft.
A Berry that is perfect for making a dessert due to its\nflowerlike shape and sweetness. It is sometimes dried\nand used as a good-luck charm.
A Berry with a unique bitter flavor. Boiling down these\nBerries brings out their sweetness, which makes it easier\nto eat them.
A spiky Berry. It’s sour, as you can imagine from\nits appearance. It’s said to latch on to a Pokémon with\nits tiny hooks so it can be carried to far-off places.
A Berry that’s incredibly hard and spicy. It was used\nas medicine in the past.
A Berry that has a dry flavor, which is unimaginable from\nits roundish appearance. It’s good for neutralizing the\nsmell of other ingredients.
A slightly rare Berry. When you eat it, its spicy and\nsweet flavors clash in your mouth.
A slightly rare Berry with unique flavors. Its intense dry\nand bitter flavors are loved by some and hated\nby others.
A slightly rare Berry. The flesh underneath its bumpy\nskin is incredibly sweet and sour.
A slightly rare Berry. It’s eye-poppingly spicy and bitter,\nbut it’s packed with nutrients.
A slightly rare Berry. Its blue part has a very dry flavor\nand its green part has a very sour flavor.
A very rare Berry. It’s said that holding a Lansat Berry\nbrings joy. It has an intriguing flavor.
A Berry that’s considered a myth. It’s said to have\nextremely strong power. Its delicious flavor\nis otherworldly.
A rare and completely enigmatic Berry. You won’t know\nwhat it tastes like until you eat it.
A very rare Berry. Its very dry flavor makes other\ningredients taste sweet.
A very rare Berry. The flesh underneath its tough skin is\nsweet and creamy soft.
A very rare Berry. It needs to be handled carefully—\notherwise its bitter drupelets will pop.
A very rare Berry. It’s so sour that it could make\npeople cry, so you need to use it little by little by\ndividing it into small pieces.
A Berry that can be used for herbal tea. Its rich\nsweetness and elegant fragrance make this Berry\nperfect as an ingredient in a sophisticated dish.
A slightly rare Berry. You’ll be hit first by its burning\nspiciness, then its extreme bitterness.
A slightly rare Berry. Its outside is very bitter, but its\ninside tastes like a sweet drink.

Text File : trainer_license_character
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
This Pokémon Trainer got endorsed to take\npart in the Gym Challenge by his brother—\nthe reigning Champion, Leon. Hop claims\nto have watched all Leon’s matches.\nCommentators speculate that as a result, he\nmight be quite the force to be reckoned\nwith. The Champion himself has said that\nhis brother has potential, but his carefully\nhoarded knowledge can go to waste as he\ntends to get easily flustered in battle.\nIt’s said that Hop’s partner Wooloo is a\ngreat help to him both in battle and with\nchores around the house.
This Trainer ultimately was defeated in the\nfinal match of the Champion Cup\nSemifinals. However, many Gym\nLeaders speak highly of his battle style,\nwhere he will let his Pokémon battle freely\nand really enjoy themselves. During the\nincident with Eternatus, he provided vital\nassistance in resolving the situation,\nproving beyond doubt that he is a skilled\nTrainer in his own right. It is expected that\nhis battles with the new Champion will be\nthe stuff of legend.
[~ 2]
[~ 3]
[~ 4]
[~ 5]
As a child, she was timid and a bit of a\ncrybaby. However, she became more\ncheerful as she played with the Pokémon\nshe received from her brother, and her\ntalents as a Trainer also grew greatly. She\njoined the Gym Challenge because she\nwishes to breathe life back into her\ndilapidated hometown, but she says she has\nbeen somewhat distracted by the boutiques\nthroughout Galar. Though many in Spikemuth\nsee her as a local celebrity, she herself\nhas no interest in pursuing fame. However,\nshe says she does appreciate the support of\nTeam Yell, her personal cheering squad.
She was appointed as the new Gym Leader\nof Spikemuth by her brother Piers. Piers\ncaught Morpeko and gave it to her when\nshe was five. She still finds herself at the\nmercy of Morpeko’s mood swings even now.\nThe local dialect of Spikemuth has a\ndistinct kick to it, and many of Marnie’s\nfans have started mimicking her.\nMarnie won’t change her expression even\nwhen she gets angry, but once something\nsets her off, she stays angry for a long time.
[~ 8]
[~ 9]
[~ 10]
[~ 11]
This Trainer was born as the son of farmers.\nHe has honed his strength, stamina, and\nskill as a Pokémon Trainer from a young\nage by working together with his Pokémon.\nBecause of his gentle nature, he has trouble\ngoing all out on weaker opponents, which is\nwhy his Gym is the first one for challengers\nto attempt during the Gym Challenge. He\nalways wears his boots, as apparently they\nlet him dig in his heels when he needs to.
Though his record isn’t the best due to his\nfocus on simply having fun in battles, Milo\nhimself is incredibly strong. The rolls of hay\nused in his Gym Challenge each weigh over\n770 pounds, yet Milo can roll them\naround easily. Wooloo tend to roll around,\ntoo, and sometimes they can get carried\naway and roll out of the Gym Stadium. It\nhas become common in Turffield to see the\nwhole town chasing after Milo, who is in\nturn chasing after a stray Wooloo, along\nwith Yamper.
[~ 14]
[~ 15]
[~ 16]
[~ 17]
Her father is a fisher, and her mother works\nin the marketplace. Perhaps because of\nher parents, she grew up playing with\nWater-type Pokémon and eventually made\nit all the way to being a Gym Leader.\nShe met Sonia during their Gym Challenge,\nand they continue to be close friends.\nNessa often gives Sonia fresh seafood from\nHulbury. She has declared that Milo of\nTurffield is her rival, but Milo responded by\nsaying that his rival is himself.
Nessa is incredibly popular, both as a Gym\nLeader and as a model. Many people even\nthink the Gym Leader Nessa and the model\nNessa are two different people, since she\nshows a completely different attitude in\neach role. She had the misfortune of being\ndefeated in the first match of the Finals,\nand those who knew of her indomitable\nnature worried that this would impact her\nwork as a model. Despite her loss, she was\nstill able to give her fans a perfect smile.\nThings were not nearly as peaceful with her\nGym, however...
[~ 20]
[~ 21]
[~ 22]
[~ 23]
Kabu is a Pokémon Trainer who was invited\nfrom the Hoenn region. There were a few\ntimes where he was very close to becoming\nChampion, but victory always seemed to\nelude him at the last moment. Because of\nthis, he adopted a no-holds-barred\napproach to battling for a time, but even\nthat did not bring the results he wanted. He\neven dropped to the minor division at one\npoint, but after a fantastic battle with Leon,\nhe regained faith in his own potential.\nHis motto is to keep learning and training\nas long as he is alive.
Interview with Challenger Kabu\nQ: How do you see your own battle style?\nKabu: Just, straightforward, direct. I’m still\nyoung, so I try to keep things simple. Just\nburn as hot as I can, you know?\nStill, I’ve hit a bit of a losing streak, so I’ve\ntried incorporating Will-O-Wisp into my\nPokémon’s move set. That’s one thing I\nwant to tell everyone—experiment with\nevery possibility of your Pokémon. Moves,\nAbilities, items... Try everything, and there’s\nsure to be a path forward!
[~ 26]
[~ 27]
[~ 28]
[~ 29]
Given special attention from her parents,\nBea trained hard with her partner Pokémon\nsince a very young age. This has honed her\njudgment skills, and she is able to remain\ncalm and collected even when facing dire\nsituations in battle. This leads many to think\nshe lacks emotion, but the truth seems to\nbe that she doesn’t want to show weakness.\nShe is sometimes known to show her true\nfeelings to her partner Pokémon during\nbattles. She is secretly a huge fan of various\nsweets, and this has recently been found\nout by her fans. The additional attention\nhas made enjoying sweets a little difficult.
In order to become strong, one must face\nopponents who are stronger than oneself.\nEven if defeat seems inevitable, Bea will\nstill go all out and try to at least draw.\nIt’s possible that the strict (one might even\nsay too strict) training from her stern\nparents has left a burden on young Bea,\ntaking away her smile. So, who has seen\nBea smile? Her family? Her Pokémon? Or\nmaybe someone else entirely...
[~ 32]
[~ 33]
[~ 34]
[~ 35]
He is a young, mysterious Trainer who has\ntaken on the mantle of Gym Leader at a\nvery young age. He has never been known\nto remove his mask in public. In fact, he\nhas at least one hundred masks of the same\ndesign, just to keep spares handy should his\nmask fall off for some reason. He claims to\nhave developed the ability to see deceased\nGhost-type Pokémon after an accident he\nhad when he was four years old, but the\ntruth is still a mystery.
This is a photo that happened to capture\nAllister in his locker room. He can be seen\nclutching the mask that normally hides his\nface, no doubt confronting the fears and\ninsecurities he feels within. Even though he\nhas taken the role of Gym Leader at a very\nyoung age, it is clear that off the pitch he is\nstill very much a normal boy. However, one\nmystery remains—nobody knows who took\nthis photo. Some even claim it was the work\nof Ghost-type Pokémon.
[~ 38]
[~ 39]
[~ 40]
[~ 41]
Opal is the oldest Gym Leader in the Galar\nregion. She took over for her mother 70\nyears ago and has kept the position since.\nHowever, she feels that her own values\nhave reached their limits, and thus she is\ncurrently looking for a worthy successor.\nShe claims that she gives deliberately tricky\nquizzes because people reveal their true\ncolors when in a pinch, but many speculate\nthat in reality, she does it out of pure spite.
Opal has thrust the duties of Gym Leader\nonto Bede, who had his Gym Challenger\nstatus revoked. That being said, she still\nshows up at the Gym Stadium every day,\ngiving unsolicited advice, coming up with\nnew quiz questions, and practicing various\nperformances. What is this “pink” she\ninsisted others show her? Maybe a clue lies\nin a comment she made during an old\ninterview. “Keep thinking about the right\nanswer, and eventually you’ll create the\nright answer.”
[~ 44]
[~ 45]
[~ 46]
[~ 47]
Gordie is a young rising star that many\nsuspect will be the Champion someday.\nThough Rock-type Pokémon are typically\nknown for being rough and unrelenting,\nGordie has worked hard to achieve victory\nthrough a refined and graceful battle style.\nHe always tries to keep his fans happy and\nthus is very popular among the audience.\nOn the other hand, he has the surprising\ntendency of shutting himself away in the\nlocker room when he is defeated, making\npostdefeat interviews a rarity. This doesn’t\nbother most of his fans, though, and they\nsee this behavior as endearing.
Gordie is one of the top Trainers of the\nGalar region, both in terms of popularity\nand skill. His strict training style means that\nhis Gym has few Gym Trainers, but he does\nhave quite a fan base. Gordie does his best\nto make sure his fans are happy, often seen\ngiving out autographs or hosting events.\nThere are currently three photo albums of\nGordie, all published through the support\nof his fan base. This card shows another\nspecial photo, taken specifically for this\npurpose at a photo studio.
[~ 50]
[~ 51]
[~ 52]
[~ 53]
Melony has been a Gym Leader since she\nwas in her twenties. She is also known\nas a very effective coach, but her coaching\nstyle is incredibly strict. Her battle style is\nfittingly severe and stoic, as well. Any\nGym Trainers who manage to remain under\nMelony are sure to be powerful opponents.\nThus many see Circhester Stadium as a\nmajor roadblock for Gym Challengers. Many\nquietly speculate that Melony’s harsh\nbattle style is due to a fight she had with\nher son.
Melony wanted Gordie to take over as the\nGym Leader of Circhester, while Gordie\nwanted to dedicate himself to Rock-type\nPokémon. The Pokémon battle between\nthe two ended up dividing the whole town.\nEver since that day, Melony and Gordie\nhardly ever see each other. That being said,\nMelony supposedly managed to become\nthe first member of Gordie’s fan club.\nGordie seems to have a complicated\nexpression in their photo together, but\nthen again, that may just be one’s\nown imagination...
[~ 56]
[~ 57]
[~ 58]
[~ 59]
Spikemuth lacks a Power Spot that would\nallow Pokémon to Dynamax, and thus not\nmany fans come to visit the town. Piers\nfeels responsible for allowing his town to\nfall into obscurity and dilapidation.\nOnce in battle, Piers tends to get riled up\nand will often reveal his strategy early on,\nbut he has the strength and skill to triumph\nregardless. However, his true passions are\nsinging and song writing, and his talents in\nthese fields are well-known. As such, he\ncurrently hopes that his younger sister will\ntake over as Gym Leader.
Here are some words from Piers when he\nfirst became the Gym Leader of Spikemuth.\n“Uh... ... ... The name’s Piers. It’s too bad\nwe can’t Dynamax our Pokémon in\nSpikemuth, but you could say we have a\nmore authentic style of Pokémon battles.\nAnd I plan on showin’ that off. And well...\nI have a younger sister, and she’s got way\nmore talent than me. But until she’s old\nenough to become Gym Leader, I’ll keep\nrockin’ with my crew and make sure\nSpikemuth stays lively!”
[~ 62]
[~ 63]
[~ 64]
[~ 65]
Raihan is commonly regarded as the most\nskilled Gym Leader in the Galar region. He\nhas striven for victory in every environment,\nand as a result, he has adopted a battle\nstyle where he utilizes weather effects to\ntheir fullest. It is rumored that he could\neasily become another region’s Champion\nshould he choose to move, but it seems\nthat to Raihan, defeating Leon is much\nmore important. His uploaded selfies are\nquite popular. Occasionally he’ll post a\nphoto that only shows a sandstorm.
Raihan started taking selfies so as to never\nforget the pain of his defeats, but more\nrecently he has been taking photos showing\noff his training routine, his fashion choices,\nand the like, causing some fans to leave\nharsh comments whenever he loses to Leon.\nIt’s true that Raihan is on a ten-nil losing\nstreak against Leon, but no other Pokémon\nTrainer has managed to KO as many of\nLeon’s Pokémon as Raihan has. Raihan no\ndoubt looks forward to taking a selfie after\nfinally defeating Leon.
[~ 68]
[~ 69]
[~ 70]
[~ 71]
Leon is known far and wide for taking part\nin the Gym Challenge at the tender age of\n10 years old—and even more so for claiming\nvictory in the Champion Cup on his first\nattempt. Ever since that victory, he and his\npartner Charizard have remained unbeaten\nin both League and exhibition matches. He\nis called “the unbeatable Champion” and is\na hero to many Trainers. He has but one\nweakness: a dismal sense of direction.\nBut don’t worry—wherever he ends up, he\nmakes sure everyone has a champion time!
Leon’s dream, even when he was still the\nChampion, was to make Galarian Trainers\nthe strongest Trainers in the world. In order\nto fulfill that dream, he has rebuilt Rose\nTower into the Battle Tower, a facility\ndedicated to Pokémon battles. People say\nthat he seems even more lively now than\nhe was as Champion. Leon has also\ncommented that another reason he likes the\ntower so much is because it’s impossible to\nget lost inside. Leon’s biggest problem now\nis apparently coming up with a new\nsignature catchphrase to replace\n“Let’s have a champion time!”
[~ 74]
[~ 75]
[~ 76]
[~ 77]
Mr. Rose is in fact a talented Trainer, coming\nin second place for a past Champion Cup.\nAs the chairman of the Pokémon League,\nand as the president of a large business\nconglomerate, he is truly a hero to the\nGalar region, working tirelessly to ensure\nits prosperity. His thoughts and words don’t\nalways match, and thus many say it’s hard\nto tell what he’s talking about. In fact, it is\nsaid that only his secretary can tell what\nhis true intent is.\n(NOTE: The above text was submitted by\nhis secretary.)
Chairman Rose is a dedicated philanthropist\nwho spent much of his own time and money\nresearching the ancient disaster known as\nthe Darkest Day, all in order to solve\nGalar’s energy issues. He firmly believes\nthat actions speak louder than words and\nwill often make decisions without revealing\nhis thinking to others. For better or for\nworse, it is this style of leadership that has\nallowed the Macro Cosmos conglomerate\nto grow to where it is today.\n(NOTE: The above text was submitted by\nhis secretary.)
[~ 80]
[~ 81]
[~ 82]
[~ 83]
Bede spent some time living in an\norphanage after his family ran into some\ntrouble when he was young. He always had\ndifficulty getting along with others and\nwould constantly get into fights. That is\nuntil one day Chairman Rose visited the\nfacility. Rose gave Bede a Pokémon, which\nchanged Bede’s life forever. He showed\ntalent as a Trainer and threw himself into\nPokémon battles, becoming stronger by the\nday. He has joined the Gym Challenge with\nan endorsement from the chairman himself,\nand Bede plans to prove that the chairman’s\nfaith was not misplaced.
He was appointed by the former Gym Leader\nOpal to become the new Gym Leader of\nBallonlea Stadium. The general consensus\nis that Opal’s harsh training has in fact\nmellowed him out. Though he himself has\nnever confirmed nor denied this, it should\nbe noted that he no longer refuses to give\nautographs. Additionally, it seems his skills\nas a Pokémon Trainer have also increased\nrather dramatically. Recently, his intrusion\nduring the Finals of the Champion Cup has\ngained popularity, and fans wish to see that\nkind of performance again. Bede himself is\nnot sure how to react.
[~ 86]
[~ 87]
[~ 88]
[~ 89]
This mysterious figure has taken it upon\nhimself (herself?) to dress up in the fashion\nof the Pokémon League’s official mascot.\nThe mysterious individual is known to many\nas “the Ball Guy” but in point of fact, all\nare mystified when it comes to this person’s\ntrue identity or age or even gender. While\nthe Ball Guy is known for her (his?) habit of\nhanding out rare Poké Balls here and there\naround Galar, it’s a mystery as to why or\neven where these balls come from. It’s all\nvery mystifying...
[~ 91]
[~ 92]
[~ 93]
[~ 94]
Mustard is the former Fighting-type Gym\nLeader and is regarded as one of the\nstrongest Champions in Galar’s history—\nreigning undefeated for 18 years. His\nintense drive for strength meant he insisted\non discipline, both in himself and in others.\nHis character changed drastically, however,\nafter his post-retirement globe-trotting. His\nsudden purchase of a deserted island\nadded to the surprise of those around him.\nWhen asked for his reasoning, he answered\nwith a smile, “There are lots of ways to be\nstrong in this world. I want to see them all!”\nThe name “Isle of Armor” was also his idea.
This photo was taken about 50 years ago,\nwhen Mustard defeated the Fairy-type Gym\nLeader and went on to become Champion.\nHe reigned undefeated until he lost his\npartner Pokémon. After this, his losses\nstarted to mount. He remained popular\neven after losing the mantle of Champion,\nbut decided to retire after the league\nchairman at that time asked him to win in a\nrigged match. Mustard developed an\nobsession with video games after his\nretirement. Apparently he held off while he\nwas still active in order to maintain his\nimage to his fans.
Honey is the former CEO of a trading firm.\nShe met Mustard while visiting Galar during\none of her many business trips, and it was\nlove at first sight. They were married shortly\nafterward. She now works as the dojo\nmatron—cooking, cleaning, advertising,\nand taking care of finances. She also keeps\nan eye on the mental health of students.\nWhat’s more, she’s also the creator of Max\nSoup. She used the forest mushrooms in her\nsoup as a way to cut costs, and this caused\nher Pokémon to Gigantamax. Her latest\nambition is to sell ready-made Max Soup\nacross the world. Her motto is teamwork.
Honey wasn’t a Trainer initially, but after\nspending time with Mustard, she tried\nit out on a whim. She quickly developed a\ntalent for battle, and the rumor among\ndojo students is that she may even be on\npar with Mustard himself. Thanks to taking\ncare of very powerful Pokémon at the dojo,\nHoney has also gained a lot of physical\nstrength of her own. Now she can handle\neven powerful Pokémon, like Gallade.
Avery comes from a long-standing family of\npsychics. Each Psychic-type Gym Leader of\nGalar has been from the same bloodline as\nAvery, and thus, Avery has been destined to\nbear the burden of Gym Leader since even\nbefore he was born. Ever since he was a\nchild, Avery could freely move things with\nhis mind but lacked other skills, such as\nteleportation or telepathy. This has caused\nthe rest of his family to label him as a\ndisappointment. Avery has a great deal of\nrespect for Slowpoke, as they go about\ntheir business at their own pace, no matter\nwhat others say.
Avery has always been very proud and\nwould levitate any opponent who dared\ndefeat him. This behavior caused his status\nas a Gym Trainer to be revoked. During this\ntime of despair and desperation, his\nSlowpoke found a flyer for the Master Dojo,\nleading to Avery’s current circumstances.\nAvery caused friction with many of the other\nstudents initially, but the kindness of Honey\nand Mustard slowly helped him to mellow\nout and become more friendly. Recently he\nhas been training hard with his now-evolved\nSlowbro to prove himself better than a\ncertain new student at the dojo.
Klara was originally an underground pop\nsinger. She promoted herself as a star that\nhad both cuteness and the virulence of\npoison. She energetically held live concerts\nand other events, even selling some Klara-\nthemed collectibles that she made\nherself, but in spite of everything, she only\nmanaged to sell eight copies of her debut\nalbum “Krazy for Klara.” She decided\nbecoming a Gym Leader would help her\ngain more popularity and has been working\ntoward that goal since. She chose the\nPoison type because it matched her image\nand there was less competition.
The training at the Poison-type Gym was a\nlot harsher than Klara was ready for, and\nshe gave up after two days. It was during\nthis time she saw an ad for the Master Dojo\nduring a late-night TV show. The master\nseemed kind, and Klara thought it would\nhelp her become strong without having to\ntry too hard, so she immediately called in\nto apply. Normally, Klara’s sole focus is to\nbe doted on by others, so she puts only\nthe bare minimum into her training, but\nrecently a new student at the dojo has\ncaused a change of attitude. She now works\nsecretly with her Slowbro to better herself.
Peony is a former Steel-type Gym Leader.\nHis powerful and dynamic battle style\nmeant that anyone stuck on pitch\nmaintenance had their work cut out for\nthem. To this day, he is known as “Steel\nPeony” and has many fans, especially\namong men. This photo is actually a\ncomposite photo, made before Peony came\nto the Crown Tundra. It was originally a\nposter Peony stuck in the travel planner he\nmade for his daughter, but she threw it\naway in short order. Peony liked the way it\nlooked and decided to use it for his\nLeague Card.
Though this is seldom addressed publicly,\nPeony is, in fact, Rose’s younger brother.\nPeony was compared to his brilliant older\nbrother since he was born, causing him to\ngradually rebel and become a delinquent.\nHe eventually ran away from home, only to\nbecome a Gym Leader once his talent was\nrecognized. He was even Champion once,\nbut shortly afterward, Rose became League\nChairman. This caused Peony to vanish\nentirely from the League. The Copperajah\non Peony’s team has been there since it\nwas a Cufant. It was the first Pokémon\nPeony caught together with his brother.
